notes: Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), 42 migrants attempting to cross the border illegally via boats were captured off the coast of Ayvacik, Canakkale and detained by the Coast Guard Command of Turkish Army.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), Houthi forces claimed a missile attack targeting the Essex LPG tanker (IMO: 9403877) in the Mediterranean Sea (coded to North Red Sea) claiming Israeli affiliation of the ship that it was headed to Israeli ports. There were no fatalities or injuries as the missiles likely impacted the water. This was the first attack that Houthi forces claimed in the Mediterranean Sea. The attack was not confirmed by other sources. A spokesperson for the company managing the ship said that there had been no sign of anything unusual while the ship was anchored off the coast of Egypt's Alexandria port on 24 May. Houthi forces claimed the attack on 24 May without specifying the date of the attack. The ship was operated and managed by UK-registered company Zodiac Maritime, owned by Israeli shipping magnate Eyal Ofer.

They accused him of delivering hate speeches against them, defunding programs that benefited them, and dismissing state workers who were covered by the work quota that the law grants to this group. The protesters also demanded that, through a law, the State recognize and compensate the victims of persecution, imprisonment, murder, and abandonment that members of the group suffered during the civil-military dictatorship.

Several rockets fell in Dovev, causing damage to houses and a synagogue. No casualties occurred. In response, Israeli military forces shelled the launch sites. In a separate incident, Hezbollah forces fired anti-tank missiles at Dovev, also causing damage.

Interception: On 24 May 2024, Israeli military forces intercepted a 'suspicious aerial target' -- likely armed -- over the area of Dishon (Zefat, HaZafon). Hezbollah forces in Lebanon likely launched the aerial object.

Protesters also raised signs and chanted slogans demanding the trial of a person that killed an Israeli Arab civilian during the clashes. Protesters also marched in support of Palestinians in Gaza. During the march, several Israeli Jews approached the march and screamed racist slogans and 'death to Arabs' at the protesters, but did not intervene otherwise.

On 24 May 2024, dozens of Israeli Arab protesters performed Friday prayers in the displaced village of Lajjun, in the area of Megiddo (Yizreel, HaZafon) against Israeli plans to transform the village's remains into a promenade. The protest was organized by the Popular Committee - Umm al Fahm and the Committee for the Commemoration of the Martyrs of Lajjun Umm al-Fahm.

On 24 May 2024, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Nakuru County protested in Naivasha town (Naivasha, Nakuru) against their employment terms. Joined by KUPPET representatives, the group demanded the government through the Teachers' Service Commission (TSC) to comply with a recent court order to grant them permanent and pensionable employment terms as well as compensation for the period worked while underpaid.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), traders and consumers of mogoka (type of khat) protested in Mombasa (Mvita, Mombasa) against the move by the county government to ban the sale of the substance in the county.

On 24 May 2024, market traders protested in Korogocho neighborhood of Nairobi - Ruaraka (Ruaraka, Nairobi) against the move by a private developer to demolish their stalls. The group demanded both the governor and the president to help address their grievance.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), internally displaced persons (IDP) protested at the Garissa police training IDP camp (Garissa, Garissa) against the move by the government to order them to go back to their homes, alleging their homes are still flooded and uninhabitable. Led by the camp chairperson, the group demanded more time until the floods receded.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), a mob attempted to demolish the house of a man, accused of killing a woman in the area, in Riangiri village in Embu County (coded to the county headquarters as Embu, Manyatta, Embu). Police used unspecified means to intervene.

On 24 May 2024, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Mashuru zone protested in Mashuuru (Kajiado East, Kajiado) against their employment terms. The group demanded the government through the Teachers' Service Commission (TSC) to comply with a recent court order to grant them permanent and pensionable employment terms as well as compensation for the period worked while underpaid.

On 24 May 2024, a group of Junior Secondary School (JSS) intern teachers from Migori County protested in Migori (Suna West, Migori) against their employment terms. The group demanded the government through the Teachers' Service Commission (TSC) to employ them on permanent and pensionable employment terms as well as to stop intimidation.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), family members protested in an unspecified location within Kinangop constituency (location coded to the nearest known location as Kinangop, Kinangop, Nyandarua) against the recent killing of their kin, during chaos in Thika on 17 May (coded separately). The group demanded justice for the deceased.

On 24 May 2024, several members of the Motorist Association of Kenya (MAK) gathered in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi) against the proposed 2.5% motor vehicle circulation tax in the finance bill 2024. The group demanded the government to address agency inefficiencies and lower the number of traffic accidents before adding more taxes.

On 24 May 2024, residents of Al Mina neighborhood blocked the street with rocks and rubber wheels in El Ayoun, Hamed (Kankossa, Assaba) to demonstrate water shortages affecting them.

On 24 May 2024, in Mexicali, Baja California, parents of the Anne Sullivan kindergarten in Colonia Fundadores took over the campus facilities to protest against the lack of service of three refrigerators that the school has. The protesters warned that they would not allow the installation of the electoral voting at the school campus if their demand is not solved.

actors: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police
notes: On 24 May 2024, in Juan Aldama, Chihuahua, unidentified armed men shot at ministerial police officers. There were only material damages reported. There were no casualties.

On 24 May 2024, in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, at least 100 parents of the Pascual Orozco state primary school protested to demand that the state government allow them to use the textbooks of the New Mexican School, which were withdrawn after a parent of two students filed an injunction.

On 24 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, nearly 800 teachers of the CNTE blocked the central lanes of the Circuito interior around the Estela de Luz. Later, they marched to the Zocalo to continue their sit-in. The teachers asked for a fair salary payment, respect of their rights, among others. Teachers of Indigenous education also joined the protest.
On 24 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, two armed men shot a man in Tepito market. 1 fatality.

On 24 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Venustiano Carranza, members of the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) blocked road access to terminals 1 and 2 of the International Airport (AICM) to demand a 100 percent salary increase to their base salary and the repeal of the Educational Reform, among others.

On 24 May 2024, in Castanos, Coahuila de Zaragoza, about 120 workers and former workers of Altos Hornos de Mexico demonstrated to ask to speak with steel company personnel or state authorities after being summoned to a meeting by an alleged company spokesperson who did not show up. Company sources said they did not recognize the alleged spokesperson. Afterward, no more than 50 demonstrators blocked Highway 57 with stones and tires for more than two hours.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), in Agujitas, Coahuila de Zaragoza, more than 50 families of residents in Colonia del Bosque blocked access to the neighborhood to denounce the lack of electricity due to a problem with a new electrical unit. According to the Federal Electricity Commission, the construction company is responsible for the problem and not them.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), in Colima, Colima, health care workers demonstrated at the Sanitary Jurisdiction 1 of the Colima Health Secretariat to denounce that IMSS-Bienestar has not paid them. Among the protesters, there were members of SNTSA.

actors: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) State Police
notes: Property destruction: Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), in Tecoman, Colima, state police officers seized a laboratory used to manufacture drugs. Raw materials, machinery and an unspecified number of drug wrappers were also seized.

Defusal: On 24 May 2024, in Celaya, Guanajuato, a man threw two explosive devices into in the courtyard of the National Guard base located on Eje Juan Pablo Segundo. The explosives did not explode and a man identified as a Villagran City Hall worker was arrested as perpetrator. The explosives were secured by the military.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), in Celaya, Guanajuato, two men were shot dead by two armed men on a motorcycle (drive-by) in front of a beer warehouse on Avenida Herminio Martinez. The victims were wearing the uniform of a soft drink company. 2 fatalities.

On 24 May 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, two men in a car shot at a funeral procession composed of several vehicles in Colonia Valle del Campestre (drive-by). A man pulled out a gun and fired back. A girl and a man were injured. The injured man was driving one of the vehicles carrying relatives of the victim for whom the procession was held. 2 injured.

source: La Silla Rota; Milenio; Zona Franca
notes: On 24 May 2024, in Penjamo, Guanajuato, armed men entered a bar and shot and killed two men. One of the victims was the father of the current candidate of the Morena party for municipal presidency. Three people were arrested as suspected perpetrators. Among the arrested, there is the brother of the candidate's partner. The motive for the attack is not known. 2 fatalities.

source: 24 Horas (Mexico); El Sol de Acapulco; La Jornada
notes: Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, four people were killed and their dismembered human remains were found with two messages signed by a criminal group in fraccionamiento Libertadores. 4 fatalities.
On 24 May 2024, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, residents of Colonia 20 de Noviembre held a protest at the water storage tanks to demand public service in their homes.

On 24 May 2024, in El Salto, Jalisco, a man was killed and his body was found with signs of violence and his hands tied up in colonia El Bajio Lomas del Club. The victim had been kidnapped hours earlier in Tlaquepaque. 1 fatality.
On 24 May 2024, in Zapopan, Jalisco, a man was beaten up by several men with wooden boards (tableado) in colonia Miramar. He died later at the hospital. 1 fatality.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, two people were killed and their bodies were found in Colonia Miguel Hidalgo. One victim was a woman with the 'tiro de gracia'. Another body was a man who was found dismembered. 2 fatalities.

On 24 May 2024, in San Mateo Atenco, Mexico, a group of people set a police patrol on fire and placed a message addressed to the licensed municipal president, who is also a candidate for re-election by the PRI, PAN, PRD and Strength and Heart for Mexico coalition. There were no casualties.

On 24 May 2024, around Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, farmers blocked the Toluca-Atlacomulco highway to demand the intervention of state authorities in the conflict they have had with the Bionature company for more than five years. The protesters stated that the company disperses chemicals in the sky to prevent rain, mainly affecting their products.
On 24 May 2024, in Ciudad Apodaca, Nuevo Leon, two armed men arrived to a house and shot and killed a man in Colonia Paseo de las Flores. 1 fatality.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), in Linares, Nuevo Leon, a man was shot and killed in a restaurant, and another man was injured by five armed men who arrived in two vans with their faces covered and wearing tactical vests. The injured man was the owner of the restaurant, and the killed man was a friend of his. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

On 24 May 2024, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a man was shot and injured by unidentified armed men when he was outside a house in Colonia San Bernabe. The house was searched and secured for drug dealing in the past.

On 24 May 2024, in Oaxaca de Juarez, Oaxaca, teachers and members of the CNTE blocked all accesses to the airport to demand the acceptance of a list of demands to improve their working conditions. The protesters are on indefinite strike and have established sit-ins at various points in the country (coded separately). Due to the protest, the airport suspended all scheduled take-offs and landings.

On 24 May 2024, in Santa Cruz Xoxocotlan, Oaxaca, teachers from the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) blocked all accesses to the Benito Juarez international airport as part of their protests to demand the repeal of the educational reform and the ISSSTE (Social Security) law, among other demands.

On 24 May 2024, in Ayotoxco de Guerrero, Puebla, Tenampulco residents demonstrated in front of the ranch where the husband of the president of Tenampulco has a warehouse allegedly used by the president to store diverted public resources.

On 24 May 2024, in Tlaxcalancingo, Puebla, an unknown number of armed individuals shot at a house in Fraccionamiento Iskali. An armed man who was in the house shot back at the perpetrators and injured an armed individual. 1 injured.

On 24 May 2024, in Tenampulco, Puebla, a group of people demonstrated in front of the city hall to denounce corruption and misappropriation of funds by the current president, a candidate for re-election for the Morena party. The demonstrators denounced that they were being threatened with losing scholarships and programs if they did not support the president in the June 2 elections. The protesters denounced that the president keeps resources such as expenses and construction materials that should be allocated to the population in a warehouse owned by her husband in Ayotoxco. After the protest the demonstrators went to Ayotoxco to protest in front of the warehouse where the president hides resources (coded separately).
On 24 May 2024, in Guasave, Sinaloa, mothers of children who attend a kinder garden held a protest to demand justice after a little girl was sexually abuse by her teacher in last November.

Property destruction: Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), in the municipality of Navojoa, Sonora, military forces destroyed four marijuana plantations near Los Otates ranch. Military forces also destroyed another four marijuana plantations in the town known as Huicochi.

On 24 May 2024, in Altamira, Tamaulipas, residents of three communities on the Tamesi River prevented the Comapa works. The residents stated that this had caused that the level of the Champayan Lagoon drops so much that the passage of the boats becomes difficult for the residents who can only reach Altamira by boat.

On 24 May 2024, in San Fernando, Tamaulipas, approximately 50 sorghum producers from the San Fernando Valley from the municipalities of Burgos, Cruillas and Mendez closed the federal highway 101 to demand the payment of 3 thousand pesos for each ton produced to offset the price of a ton of red grain and avoid dumping actions by United States farmers.

On 24 May 2024, fishermen organized a protest in front of the region's delegation headquarters in Zarzis (Zarzis, Medenine) and called for authorities to enable them to resume their fishing activities.

On 24 May 2024, hundreds of protesters, including journalists affiliated to the SNJT and students affiliated to the UGET, organized a march from the National Syndicate of Journalists to Habib Bourguiba Street in Tunis (El Omrane, Tunis) and called for the cessation of trials against journalists and bloggers following the country's decline in freedom of expression. They also called for the criminalization of normalization with Israel and the prosecution of killers of Palestinian journalists.

On 24 May 2024, protesters staged a demonstration at the town square in Besiktas, Istanbul, to protest against a proposed bill that includes euthanizing stray dogs due to posing a perceived vital threat

On 24 May 2024, Circassian-originated citizens staged a demonstration at Icel Idman Yurdu Square in Yenisehir, Mersin to commemorate the 160th anniversary of the Circassian genocide and to call all countries, especially Turkey, to recognize the Circassian Genocide.

On 24 May 2024, protesters staged a demonstration at the Milli Birlik ve Demokrasi Square in Salihli, Manisa, to protest Israel's attacks on Gaza, in support of Palestinian people. The District National Education Director and AKP members attended.

On 24 May 2024, students continued to demonstrate at the campus of Van Yuzuncu Yil University in Ipekyolu, Van, to protest Israel's attacks on Gaza, in support of Palestinian people. Faculty members attended.

Security measures: On 24 May 2024, Sirnak Governor's Office declared Gabar ve Judi Mountain areas located in Cizre, Silopi, Uludere, Guclukonak, Beytussebap districts of the province, as 'special security zones', banning citizens' entry for 15 days due to the security risks related to the ongoing clashes with PKK.
On 24 May 2024, protesters staged a demonstration in front of the opera house in Kadikoy, Istanbul, to protest the arbitrary ban imposed on May 1 celebrations.

On 24 May 2024, protesters staged a demonstration in front of AKP in Artuklu, Mardin, to call for an end to isolation of PKK leader Abdullah Ocalan and the resolution of problems through dialogue. Representatives of DEM, TJA, DBP, Peace Mothers and Tuayder attended.

On 24 May 2024, protesters staged a demonstration in front of DEM building in Ipekyolu, Van, to call for an end to isolation of PKK leader Abdullah Ocalan and the resolution of problems through dialogue. Representatives of DEM (including MPs), TJA, DBP, and Tuayder attended.

On 24 May 2024, protesters staged a demonstration in front of AKP in Seyhan, Adana, to call for an end to isolation of PKK leader Abdullah Ocalan and the resolution of problems through dialogue. Representatives of DEM, TJA, DBP, HDK and Tuayder attended.

On 24 May 2024, protesters staged a demonstration in front of AKP in Cukurova, Mersin, to call for an end to isolation of PKK leader Abdullah Ocalan and the resolution of problems through dialogue. Representatives of DEM and Tuayder attended.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), during an operation, Turkish army soldiers opened fire on a house, containing the elderly and children, during an operation they carried out in Ortac village in Lice, Diyarbakir. There were injuries.

On 24 May 2024, DEM members staged a demonstration in front of the DEM district building in Sahinbey, Gaziantep to commemorate those who lost their lives in the Beybahce Massacre and to protest the targeting of Kurdish politicians and activists in the Kobani Trial. Representatives of DBP, HDK, ESP, SYKP, EMEP, and MPs attended.

On 24 May 2024, protesters staged a demonstration in front of the Family and Social Services Directorate in Sultanbeyli, Istanbul, to protest the release decision in the case of the perpetrators who raped a child in Sultanbeyli in 2010. Representatives of ESP and SKM attended.

Other: On 24 May 2024, villagers blocked the entrance of Pise village (Kurdish name) in Baskale district, Van, the prevent the entry of hundreds of village guards and soldiers along with the VEDAS electric company workers, who were attempting prevent villages from using of illegal electricity.

On 24 May 2024, KESK members and executives staged a demonstration in Sisli, Istanbul, to protest against austerity measures in public administration affecting urgent issues faced by public employees. Representatives of Egitim-sen attended.

On 24 May 2024, protesters staged a demonstration in front of the courthouse in Kirklareli town, to demand justice for the victims of the flood in Kirklareli's Demirkoy district. The protest was held during the second hearing of the case regarding the unlicensed business that collapsed in the flood, resulting in the deaths of six people.
On 24 May 2024, members of a religious association staged a demonstration at the Agri town, to protest Israel's attacks on Gaza, in support of Palestinian people. Representatives of HUDAPAR attended.

On 24 May 2024, students continued to demonstrate at the campus of Istanbul Medipol University in Beykoz, Istanbul, to protest Israel's attacks on Gaza, in support of Palestinian people. Faculty members attended.

Property destruction: Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), in Jesus Maria Semprun municipality (coded to Casigua El Cubo, Zulia), a contingent of the military discovered and destroyed eight camps and three makeshift airstrips, thought to belong to unidentified Colombian armed groups linked to drug trafficking. During the special operation, the security forces seized 470 KG of cocaine.

On 24 May 2024, in San Juan de los Morros (Guarico), a group of retired Guarico state judiciary workers, and lawyers, protested to demand better pay and pensions, the restoration of some of their benefits, including their medical, surgery, and maternity insurance plans (HCM), food tickets, and professionalization bonuses, and observance of their collective labor agreement. According to them, this situation is not only limited to Guarico state, but to the rest of the country, and at least 1,000 retired judiciary workers are affected by this situation. They gathered outside the Ombudsman Office.

source: Yemen Data Project; Yemen News Agency (SABA) - Houthi
notes: On 24 May 2024, a suspected Houthi landmine exploded in Hurayqiyah (Dhubab, Taizz) killing 1 civilian and injuring 4 others on a bus.

On 24 May 2024, dozens of residents from Al Kadahi held a demonstration in Al Dhihar district (coded to Az Zihar) (Ibb) denouncing the attempt of a sheikh to obstruct the implementation of a water project in their area and taking over the land of the project for himself.
Property destruction: Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), unknown people burned the house of a member of Parliament from the Patriotic Front party in Zambia (coded to Lusaka (Lusaka, Lusaka).

actors: Military Forces of Ukraine (2019-) Air Force
notes: On 24 May 2024, Ukrainian military struck with a drone an area near Rybalkin (Alekseevskiy i gorod Alekseevka, Belgorod). No casualties.
Interception: On 24 May 2024, Russian military forces intercepted 3 Ukrainian naval drones that headed toward Crimea (coded to Western Black Sea).
On 24 May 2024, one Taliban member was killed and one was wounded when their ranger was attacked by Afghanistan Freedom Front militants in the Badakhshi village of Nijrab district, Kapisa.
On 24 May 2024, dozens gathered in Tirana in protest against the new surrogacy law in Albania, urging the members of parliament to not vote on a law that legalizes and expands surrogate pregnancies.

On 24 May 2024, 20 to 25 people, including a celebrity lawyer and criminal defense attorney, gathered in Wien - Inner City (Wien) for a pro-Palestinian demonstration, where anti-Israel slogans were repeatedly chanted, leading to the protest being dispersed by the police, albeit with no reported physical interaction.

Other: On 24 May 2024, at around 5:30 am, an unidentified perpetrator threw an airsoft grenade at the Israeli Embassy in Brussels - Uccle (Brussels). There was no report of material damage. Police were investigating the motives and the perpetrator at the time of reporting.

On 24 May 2024, an unknown number of students and Fossil Free activists who had been occupying the University of Ghent in Gent (Vlaanderen) since 7 May 2024 occupied the university's rectorate, to support Palestinians and demand that the University cut its ties with Israel. About five students climbed onto the roof of the building and waved Palestinian flags. Some windows were daubed with red paint. The Rector decided to call in the police, who arrested 10 activists, who later denounced the police action as disproportionate.

On 24 May 2024, about 25 students who had been occupying the De Valk College building of the University of Leuven in Leuven (Vlaanderen) since 13 May 2024 decided to occupy the entrance hall of the rector's office. They organized the action to show support to the Palestinians as well as to the pro-Palestinian protesters who were arrested earlier that day at the University of Ghent and to demand that their university cut its ties with Israel. The University called the police, who came to drag the protesters away from the rectorate.

On 24 May 2024, an unknown number of students, teachers, and parents protested in Mesen (Vlaanderen) against the school board's decision to not permanently appoint the school director after a two-year probation period.

On 24 May 2024, several residents of Walenstraat blocked the street by jointly parking their cars and gathering in the middle of the street in Rotselaar (Vlaanderen) to protest against the use of their street as a shortcut by other drivers. They called on the municipality to take measures such as the introduction of a 30km/h speed zone.

On 24 May 2024, supporters of a defeated upazila chairman candidate assaulted the victory procession of winning AL backed chairman candidate in Kalihati upazila (Tangail, Dhaka), over electoral rivalry amid upazila parishad elections. The car of winning candidate was vandalized and his driver was also assaulted.

On 24 May 2024, at least 150-200 members of Awami League staged a protest at Dhaka-Tangail highway in Kalihati upazila (Tangail, Dhaka), against the assault on upazila AL vice president (coded separately).
On 24 May 2024, members of CPB staged a protest rally in Dhaka - Paltan (Paltan), against the Awami League government and claimed that a fascist rule has been imposed in the country.
On 24 May 2024, members of Jatiya Hindu Mahajot staged a protest in front of National Press Club, Dhaka - Paltan (Paltan), accusing certain elements of forced conversion of Hindus.
On 24 May 2024, rickshaw pullers staged a protest rally in Dhaka - Paltan (Paltan), demanding control in the prices of essential commodities.

On 24 May 2024, members of various labor groups including Socialist Labor Front (SSF) staged protest rallies in Dhaka city, demanding dedicated budget allocation to introduce a rationing system in garment factories, enabling workers to buy essential commodities at reduced prices, along with other demands.

On 24 May 2024, thousands of people, led by the daughter of a Bangladeshi MP killed in India, staged a human chain protest in Kaliganj upazila (Jhenaidah, Khulna), demanding punishment for the culprits.

On 24 May 2024, teachers and university employees protested in Ruse in support of the decision of the Council of Rectors, taken on May 17, for protest actions in higher schools, demanding not just higher salaries but also the fulfillment of previous agreements with the educational sector. The protest was organized on the holiday of Slavic writing, and the protest started in front of the presidency and marched through town.

On 24 May 2024, teachers and university employees protested in Sofia in support of the decision of the Council of Rectors, taken on May 17, for protest actions in higher schools, demanding not just higher salaries but also the fulfillment of previous agreements with the educational sector. The protest was organized on the holiday of Slavic writing, and the protest started in front of the presidency and marched through town.

On 24 May 2024, pro-Palestinian students staged a rally and maintained their encampment at the University of British Columbia's Okanagan campus in Kelowna (British Columbia) in support of Palestine, to demand that their university divest from Israeli companies and an academic boycott of Israeli universities. This was the 12th day of a campus demonstration after the arrest of student demonstrators at Columbia University in New York on 18 April. UBC Okanagan vice-chancellor offered to meet with pro-Palestinian encampment. This campus demonstration was held amid the Israel-Hamas war, which began in October 2023.

On 24 May 2024, over a dozen local residents of Lewisville held a rally in Moncton (New Brunswick) to protest against an American Iron & Metal scrapyard near their homes. Moncton city councilors Monique LeBlanc, Charles Leger, Shawn Crossman, deputy mayor Paulette Theriault, and MLA Daniel Allain (PC) were present.

On 24 May 2024, around 100 people gathered in Glovelier (Jura) to protest against the construction of the Haute-Sorne geothermal power plant, which they deemed wasteful of water resources and damaging to local biodiversity. Some protesters sprayed manure on a building.
On 24 May 2024, at the call of Syna and Unia, striking Vetropack employees gathered for a picket line in Saint-Prex (Vaud) to demand safe jobs and transparent negotiations on a pay rise.

On 24 May 2024, Turkish Cypriot livestock breeders and animal producers from across Northern Cyprus demonstrated for a fifth day in Northern Nicosia with their tractors and agricultural vehicles over the government's livestock policies and particularly the decision to import meat from the Netherlands. They also accused the government of corruption and fraud. They returned to their parked vehicles and set alight tires and hay bales. Erhan Arikli, the minister of Public Works and Transport accused the leader of the demonstrators, Mustafa Naimogullari, of slander, and threatened to sue him, although there was no record of Naimogullari directing statements at Arikli.

On 24 May 2024, around 150 people gathered outside the Humboldt University in Berlin - Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf (Berlin) to protest against antisemitism in response to the university's occupation by pro-Palestinian activists. The demonstration aimed to show solidarity with Jewish individuals, particularly Jewish students, and ensure their safety on campus.

On 24 May 2024, at the call of local Free Saxony activist Stefan Trautmann, between 110 (according to the police) and 200 (organizers) people gathered in Brand-Erbisdorf (Sachsen), to protest against the planned accommodation of refugees in the town.

On 24 May 2024, more than 100 people, including CDU politicians, gathered in front of the Synagogue in Heidelberg (Baden-Wurttemberg) to condemn racial hatred and antisemitism, following the revelation of plans to attack synagogue visitors.

On 24 May 2024, people gathered outside the Pony Bar in Kampen (Sylt) (Schleswig-Holstein) in response to a viral video filmed on Sylt featuring racist slogans. The protest aimed to condemn the behavior of the individuals involved and raise awareness about the issue of racism in society.
On 24 May 2024, people gathered in the Kirchsteigfeld district of Potsdam (Brandenburg) to protest against a planned refugee accommodation in the area.

On 24 May 2024, over 300 people, including service employees, nurses, various union members, Bundestag member Carolin Wagner (SPD), and DGB affiliates, gathered in Regensburg (Bayern) to protest against low wages and poor working conditions at the University Hospital Regensburg.

On 24 May 2024, at the call of Jusos, around 300 people, including politicians from the SPD, FW, the Greens, and CSU, gathered in Starnberg (Bayern) to protest against the AfD and right-wing violence during the party's final campaign event for the European elections at the town's Schlossberghall.

On 24 May 2024, on the occasion of the 75th anniversary of the German Basic Law and at the call of the Alliance Against the Right and various political parties, including SPD, The Greens, FDP, and FW, around 200 people, including mayor Christian Pape (independent) gathered in Wegberg (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to protest against war, hatred, and intolerance, and to promote democracy, freedom, and tolerance.

On 24 May 2024, shellfish harvesters of the estuary of O Burgo blocked the A Pasaxe bridge in A Coruna (Galicia) to demand better renovation works on the bridge so the estuary can be productive, as well as financial compensation until they can work again.

On 24 May 2024, activists, called by Arran and Forward OSAN (Endavant OSAN), held a protest at a hotel in Barcelona - Ciutat Vella (Cataluna) against the current model of mass tourism affecting the city of Barcelona and pushing residents away. Activists displayed a banner on the facade of the building.

On 24 May 2024, police officers, called by CSIF, held a protest in front of the town hall of Chipiona (Andalucia) against false accusations related to the negotiations held with the local government about their sector's new collective labor agreement.

On 24 May 2024, around 1,000 people, called by Enough! (Prou!), held a protest in front of the local government in Ibiza (Islas Baleares) against the current model of mass tourism that pushes residents away.
On 24 May 2024, striking Teleperformance employees gathered for a picket line in Belfort (Bourgogne-Franche-Comte) to demand safe jobs and more transparency from management.
On 24 May 2024, at the call of CGT and FSU, a small crowd gathered outside the local France Travail in Cabestany (Occitanie) to protest against the planned unemployment insurance reform.
On 24 May 2024, at the call of CGT, around 100 striking Nutergia employees gathered for a picket line in Causse-et-Diege (Occitanie) to demand a pay rise and better working conditions.

On 24 May 2024, at the call of Friends of the Earth (Les Amis de la Terre), Attac, and XR, around 40 people gathered outside the local TotalEnergies premise in Dijon (Bourgogne-Franche-Comte) to protest against fossil fuel extraction and the destruction of ecosystems, which they held the company responsible for. The protest occurred as TotalEnergies was celebrating its 100th anniversary.
On 24 May 2024, at the call of CFDT, around 40 striking Nutrea employees blocked access to their factory in Languidic to demand safe jobs after management announced their branch would be shut down.

On 24 May 2024, at the call of the Lannion-Trestel hospital defense committee (Comite de defense de l'hopital de Lannion-Trestel), around 40 people, including health workers, gathered outside the Sub-Prefecture in Lannion (Bretagne) to protest against the closure of the local hospital's emergency unit at night.

On 24 May 2024, at the call of Mouv'Enfants and FSSPX - Collective of Victims of the Saint-Pius X Priestly Fraternity (Collectif des Victimes de la Fraternite Sacerdotale Saint-Pie X), people gathered outside the Saint-Ignace House in Lourdes (Occitanie) to demand justice for all victims of Abbot Groche, who was accused of raping children in Gabon in the 1980s and 1990s at the time of reporting. The protesters also demanded an end to the statute of limitations for sexual crimes committed by members of the Catholic church.

On 24 May 2024, around 20 people, including students, gathered outside the Aix-Marseille University headquarters in Pharo Park in Marseille (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to protest against the director's decision to call the police to remove students blocking access to campus in support of Palestine a day before. They also condemned what they deemed police brutality and the repression of pro-Palestine activism.

On 24 May 2024, at the call of XR and Greenpeace, around 100 people, including national deputy Sandrine Rousseau (The Ecologists) and MEP Manon Aubry (LFI) gathered outside the Amundi headquarters in Paris (Ile-de-France) to demand the bank stop investing in TotalEnergies, which the demonstrators deemed responsible for global warming and the destruction of ecosystems. The action occurred as TotalEnergies was celebrating its 100th anniversary. The demonstrators formed a human chain outside the building, which security guards tried to disperse, before some participants broke into the building by smashing windows with hammers and other objects. Some demonstrators then ransacked the lobby. Security guards tried to fend them off by spraying water on them, and a brawl started. Police intervened and arrested around 100 people.

On 24 May 2024, around 600 people, including students and teachers, blocked access to the Cornouaille school before demonstrating in Quimper (Bretagne), to protest against the introduction of a school uniform, a mandatory 'national service' (SNU), the Parcoursup sorting system, and government plans to make the 'Brevet des Colleges' degree mandatory to attend high school.

On 24 May 2024, at the call of CNT and XR, around 20 people demonstrated in Saint-Etienne (Auvergne-Rhone-Alpes) to protest against fossil fuel extraction and capitalism. The protest occurred as TotalEnergies was celebrating its 100th anniversary.

On 24 May 2024, several thousand protesters marched from the Freedom Square to the Ministry of Interior in Tbilisi in solidarity with those detained or fined during the Foreign Influence Law protests.

actors: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Coast Guard
notes: Other: On 24 May 2024, Greece's coast guard picked up migrants from an islet off the Coast of Symi. They had set sail from Turkey. Migrants had been collected from the same islet the previous day, bringing the total to 22.

On 24 May 2024, dozens of fishers peacefully protested in front of the Sungailiat Fishing Port office in Sungailiat district (Bangka regency, Bangka-Belitung province). They demanded the dredging of the Sungailiat estuary to facilitate their fishing activities.

On 24 May 2024, a group of people raided a brick factory and engaged in a clash with the factory's workers on Raya Bandung Road, Hegarmanah village (Karangtengah district, Cianjur regency, West Java province). It was related to the factory's ownership dispute. They threw rocks at each other. A police officer sustained a head wound. The police arrested 50 people.

On 24 May 2024, dozens of journalists peacefully protested in front of the Zero Kilometer Monument on Sultan Hasanuddin Road, North Lolu sub-district, East Palu district, Palu city (Central Sulawesi province). They opposed the revision of the Broadcasting Law, which would restrict the distribution of investigative journalism reports. They claimed it would threaten press freedom.

On 24 May 2024, hundreds of people peacefully protested in front of the city hall in Malang city (East Java province). They voiced support for Palestine and condemned the occupation of the Palestinian territory by Israel.
On 24 May 2024, CPI(M) claimed two of his polling agents were abducted at Haldia city (Purba Medinipur district, WB) during the Lok Sabha elections.
On 24 May 2024, TMC claimed two of his polling agents were abducted at Tamluk city (Purba Medinipur district, WB) during the Lok Sabha elections.

On 24 May 2024, three Communist Party of India (Maoist) cadres, including a woman; a medical team 'commander', Nilawaya Jantana Sarkar member, a Burgum 'militia member; and a Burgum Chetna Natya Manch (CNM) member, surrendered before Police in Dantewada District (Chhattisgarh) under the Police's Lon Varratu (return to home) campaign.

actors: Police Forces of India (2014-) District Reserve Group
notes: On 24 May 2024, CPI (Maoist) rebels, clashed with 1000 joint forces of Narayanpur and Bastar DRG, Bastar fighters, and STF in the Handawada-Rekhawaya dense forest (coded as Narayanpur, Chhattisgarh), after PLGA rebels fired at STF vehicle whilst they were returning back after a 72 hour long major joint operation 'Jal Shakti'. 1 unidentified woman CPI (Maoist) rebel was killed.

On 24 May 2024, dozens of farmers, including presidents of BKU (Doaba) and Mahila Kisan Union (female farmer group), were detained by the police in the Jalandhar and Kapurthala districts in the Punjab state (coded as Chandigarh city) in a pre-emptive step to prevent the farmers from protesting at the rally of the Prime Minister (BJP) who had arrived in the state as a part of his campaign efforts for the Lok Sabha elections. The farmers were released later in the afternoon.

On 24 May 2024, unidentified persons attacked a migrant worker at Jhargram district (WB) in a case suspected to be associated with election violence. He was killed in the incident. Police is still investigating the incident.

On 24 May 2024, members of BJD clashed with BJP members with swords in Bhagabanpur village in Bhapur block (Nayagarh, Odisha) ahead of the sixth phase of Lok Sabha and simultaneous state elections. There were no casualties. The Inspector General of police, however, has denied the occurrence of violent incidents.

On 24 May 2024, members of BJD clashed with BJP members with swords in Birdi village in Khandapada block under Khandapada Assembly constituency (Nayagarh, Odisha) ahead of the sixth phase of Lok Sabha and simultaneous state elections. Three persons were injured. Inspector General of police has denied the occurrence of violent incident. Police detained two persons.

On 24 May 2024, members of two rival parties (likely BJP and BJD based on context) clashed in Handuguda village in Chhendipada block (Angul district, Odisha) ahead of the sixth phase of Lok Sabha and simultaneous state elections. 1 person was injured in the clash.
On 24 May 2024, TMC and BJP members engaged in a clash at Dantan town (Paschim Medinipur district, WB) during the Lok Sabha elections. No casualties.
On 24 May 2024, unidentified persons heckled (likely violent) a BJP candidate at Haldia town (Purba Medinipur district, WB) during the Lok Sabha elections.
On 24 May 2024, unidentified persons assaulted a BJP polling agent and forced him to leave the booth at Ghatal town (Paschim Medinipur district, WB) during the Lok Sabha elections.

actors: Police Forces of India (2014-) Central Industrial Security Force
notes: On 24 May 2024, women pelted stones at a BJP candidate's vehicle and central forces convoy (likely CRPF given they form the bulk of the forces) at Garbeta town (Paschim Medinipur district, WB) during the Lok Sabha elections. The BJP candidate and CISF personnel were left injured in the incident.

On 24 May 2024, a mob vandalized a car in the Zenda Chowk area of Kotwali police limits in Nagpur city (Maharashtra) after it hit three persons. The police detained three people, including the driver, after the incident.

Other: On 24 May 2024, administration in the presence of the officials of the revenue department and the police administration bulldozed an illegal house constructed by the father of the juvenile murder accused in Balaghat district (Madhya Pradesh).

On 24 May 2024, ABVP members held a sit-in protest at Siliguri city (Darjeeling district, WB) over the suicide of a research scholar and demanded the arrest of a professor claimed to be responsible for it.
On 24 May 2024, CPI(M) members held a protest at Siliguri city (Darjeeling district, WB) to demand a reduction in power bills.

On 24 May 2024, a large number of farmers (on buses), including the BKU (Doaba) president, staged a protest, wearing black badges, along the road close to Bath Castle near Pragpur village (Jalandhar, Punjab) when they were stopped from marching towards Jalandhar city where the Prime Minister of India (BJP) was conducting a campaign rally for the Lok Sabha elections. Farmers in the state have been staging protests condemning the BJP-led central government for the excessive intervention during the farmer's 'Delhi Chalo' protests and for failing to address their long-standing demands.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), hundreds of bar and pub owners wearing black T-shirts held a protest in Pune city (Maharashtra) against the clampdown on their businesses after a fatal hit-and-run case involving a minor driving a Porsche in an inebriated state.

On 24 May 2024, street vendors held a protest at Muthi town (Jammu district, J&K) against the municipal authority over the anti-encroachment drive and being removed from the area where they have been operating for the last 20-30 years.
On 24 May 2024, MSJK members held a protest at Jammu city (J&K) against the power department over the billing system, fluctuation of power and frequent power cuts.

On 24 May 2024, members of Bajrang Dal and RSS (likely members of Cow Protection Groups based on the issue) staged a protest in Baripur village (Moradabad, Uttar Pradesh) after the carcasses of bovine animals were found in the field. The protesters claimed that smugglers were slaughtering cows in the area.

On 24 May 2024, members of the All Gujarat Students' Union (AGSU) held a protest at the MSU head office in Vadodara city (Gujarat) demanding an increase in the quota for local students from Vadodara from 70 percent to 90 percent.
On 24 May 2024, TMC supporters held a protest at Bankura district (WB) against BJP candidates during the Lok Sabha elections.
On 24 May 2024, TMC supporters held a protest at Purulia district (WB) against BJP candidates during the Lok Sabha elections.
On 24 May 2024, TMC supporters held a protest against BJP candidates by blocking a BJP candidate's convoy at Ghatal town (Paschim Medinipur district, WB) during the Lok Sabha elections.

On 24 May 2024, members of Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups (PVTGs) from Ajayapuram village in Anakapalli district and members of the Andhra Pradesh Girijana Sangham (tribal group) staged a protest in Cheemalapadu village (Krishna, Andhra Pradesh) against the administration for not paying the entire amount of their Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) (social employment scheme) wages despite having worked for six days of the week. The protesters held spades and rakes to mark their protest.

On 24 May 2024, VHP along with members of the Bangiya Sanyasi Samaj (a Hindu religious body) held a protest march as part of 'Sant Swabhiman Yatra' at Kolkata city (WB) against the TMC-led state government's chief's claimed statement insulting priests at Ramakrishna Mission and Bharat Sevasharam Sangha.

On 24 May 2024, VHP along with members of the Bangiya Sanyasi Samaj (a Hindu religious body) held protest marches as part of 'Sant Swabhiman Yatra' across WB (coded as Kolkata city (WB)) against the TMC-led state government's chief's claimed statement insulting priests at Ramakrishna Mission and Bharat Sevasharam Sangha.

On 24 May 2024, VHP along with members of the Bangiya Sanyasi Samaj (a Hindu religious body) held a protest march as part of 'Sant Swabhiman Yatra' at Siliguri city (Darjeeling district, WB) against the TMC-led state government's chief's claimed statement insulting priests at Ramakrishna Mission and Bharat Sevasharam Sangha.
On 24 May 2024, residents held a protest in in Bairagarh locality of Bhopal city (Madhya Pradesh) against unscheduled power cuts.
On 24 May 2024, residents gathered and staged a two-hour-long protest at Gumashta Nagar electricity zone in Indore city (Madhya Pradesh) against unscheduled power cuts.

On 24 May 2024, family members and students took out a protest rally and attempted to 'lay siege' to the Maruthi College of Nursing in Bhadrachalam town (Khammam, Telangana) demanding a fair investigation into the suspicious death of a first year nursing student. The protesters attempted to manhandle a college management representative, and the police intervened and brought the situation under control.

On 24 May 2024, a hundred residents blocked a national highway, threw stones and burned tires in Gamadi village (Sabar Kantha, Gujarat) during a demonstration against the death of a local in a road accident. Three police personnel sustained injuries. A police van was also set alight by the mob. Police used tear gas shells to disperse the crowd.

On 24 May 2024, RPF cadres shot a man on his leg in Wangoo Ahallup village (Bishnupur, Manipur) for suspected involvement in a rape case of a differently abled woman. He was instructed to pay Rs 5 lakhs to the victim's family and was ostracized for 5 years from his locality.

On 24 May 2024, unidentified armed assailants shot a man on his leg at Akasoi Sellungkhong Maril under Kumbi police station limits (Bishnupur, Manipur) over unknown reasons amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and tribal communities in the state. He was taken to Wangoo Laipham Primary Health Centre and then to Jawaharlal Nehru Institute of Medical Sciences (JNIMS) hospital for treatment.

actors: Police Forces of India (2014-) Assam Rifles
notes: Weapons seizure: On 24 May 2024, Assam Rifles personnel and Indian Army retrieved arms and ammunition belonging to unidentified armed assailants during a search operation at Bongbal Khullen area in Imphal East district (coded to Porompat town, Imphal East, Manipur) amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and Tribal communities in the state. Recovered items included one AK-56 rifle, one mortar, one improvised mortar bomb, one Pompi gun, two improvised explosive devices (IEDs), five hand grenades, ammunition, and other war-like stores.

On 24 May 2024, suspected Kuki assailants attacked 2 Meitei men with slingshots from the hillside of Houkip Punji area along NH-37 while they were on their way to Jiribam town (coded to Jiribam town, Jiribam, Manipur) amidst ongoing violence between Meitei and tribal communities in the state. The shots hit the rear side of the car window.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), locals physically assaulted a man in Gandhigram town (West Tripura, Tripura) who sexually molested a minor on the pretext of asking her for mangoes. He was later handed over to the police.

On 24 May 2024, residents of a housing project run by Cluid Housing held a protest in Dublin (Dublin) to demand the reinstatement of a physical security presence for the residential complex due to a rise of anti-social behavior in the area.

On 24 May 2024, at the call of UIL, CISL and CGIL, hundreds of construction workers gathered in front of the prefecture in Napoli (Campania) to protest against work-related deaths and to call on institutions to guarantee safety at work, following a deadly accident that occurred on the construction sites of metro lines.

On 24 May 2024, plaintiffs involved in a lawsuit marched around the Hiroshima High Court Okayama Branch in Okayama, Okayama, claiming that security-related laws that allowed the exercise of the right of collective self-defense were unconstitutional.

On 24 May 2024, about 20 medics gathered outside their state-subsidized apartment building in Petropavl city of North Kazakhstan region in protest of eviction from their housing calling for the authorities to resolve the dispute.

On 24 May 2024, workers of the Zhalgiztobemunay company protested on the premises near the town of Fort-Shevchenko in Tupkaragan district of Mangystau region against mass lay off demanding that their employer re-hire laid off workers, stop persecution of labor activists, accept collective agreement and that the authorities probe the company's record. The company and workers came to agreement and resolved the labor dispute resulting in workers ending the protest.

On 24 May 2024, about 30 flood victims gathered outside the Mayor's office near Oral district in Uralsk city of West Kazakhstan region in protest of the authorities' failure to include protesting residents in the list for housing program after flooding demanding a meeting with city officials to address victims' concerns.

On 24 May 2024, Prospective Residents Council of New Central Doosan We've the Zenith held a demonstration in front of Daegu Metropolitan City Hall Sangyeok Annex (Daegu - Buk). They urged the authorities to carry out inspection thoroughly before approving the apartment complex construction project.

On 24 May 2024, members of Daegu Citizen Action for Climate Crisis held a press conference and picketed in front of Daegu Metropolitan City Hall (Daegu - Jung). They urged the authorities to stop operating a coal-fired power plant which is located in the center of the city concerning environmental and health concerns.

On 24 May 2024, protesters, including members of the Daegu Queer Culture Festival Organizing Committee, held a press conference with a banner and picketed in front of Daegu District Court (Daegu - Suseong). They supported the court's decision and urged the local government to stop 'unfairly' oppressing Daegu Queer Culture Festival held in the city center.

On 24 May 2024, local disability advocacy groups, including Disabled People's Community, held a press conference and picketed in front of the Daegu Metropolitan Office of Education (Daegu - Suseong). They urged the authorities to provide measures for adults with disabilities to pursue high school education.

On 24 May 2024, about 70 protesters, including residents, neighborhood leaders and local women' groups, such as Domestic and Sexual Violence Center, Gyeonggi Provincial Council of Women, held a demonstration near Suwon City Hall (Suwon). They opposed a serial sexual assault criminal living in their neighborhood, citing safety concerns.

On 24 May 2024, about 700 (employer estimate) to 2,000 (organizer estimate) members of the National Samsung Electronics Union (NSEU) held a demonstration in front of the Samsung Electronics headquarters (Seoul City - Seocho). They urged Samsung to provide employees with a fair bonus system during wage negotiations.

On 24 May 2024, members of the National Task Force of Victims of Jeonse Rental Fraud held a press conference and displayed banners in front of the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo). They called for revising the special bill to assist victims of housing rental scams ('jeonse scams').

On 24 May 2024, Korean Nurses Association members held a press conference and picketed near the Office of the President (Seoul City - Yongsan). They urged the authorities to enact the Nursing Act and promote the rights of nurses.
On 24 May 2024, about 200 residents of Muan County held a protest at Muan Traditional Market (Seongnae). They opposed the relocation of Gwangju Military Airport to Muan without people's consent.

On 24 May 2024, about 300 local civic group members held a rally in front of Jeonnam-do East Provincial Government (Haeryong). They urged the South Jeolla provincial government to stop the 'unfair' medical school bidding process and establish a medical school at the Sunchon National University.

On 24 May 2024, about 50 people gathered to demand justice for Jonathan Aubry in Petange (Luxembourg). They denounced that the investigation was too slow and not transparent enough. The French man died in troubled circumstances in a nightclub in the municipality in December 2023. The event was organized by the victim's widow.

On 24 May 2024, the Gutsul team and Shor supporters protested at the construction site of an amusement park on the outskirts of Congaz against the ban on the construction of GagauziyaLand from technical supervision. Evghenia Gutul spoke at the event, accusing the country's president of being responsible for parents' inability to provide a happy childhood for their children and criticizing the authorities for their lack of action for the Gagauz people.

On 24 May 2024, the Communist and Socialist parties, along with their supporters, gathered in front of the government in Chisinau - Buiucani, demanding the resignation of the Minister of Education and opposing the reorganization of educational institutions, fearing closures of schools, universities, colleges, and other facilities. Attendees criticized the Ministry of Education for its failure to build cooperation with teaching and parent teams, as well as the academic environment. Additionally, speeches were delivered by members of parliament. The event turned violent when the rioters attacked a woman expressing dissent, prompting police intervention to stop the attack.

Displacement: On 24 May 2024, in Madaya township (Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), over 500 locals from six villages, including Gyoe Gyar Kan village, were forced to flee their homes due to the military raiding the villages.

Displacement: On 24 May 2024, in Salin township (Minbu district, Magway region), about 1,000 villagers from Kone Char, Let Pan Kyin, Man Gyi Kone, Thea and Kyone villages were forced to flee their homes due to the military raids.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Myanmar Pressphoto Agency
notes: Property destruction: On 24 May 2024, in Kone Char village (Salin township, Minbu district, Magway region), the military (No.21 Military Production Base) set fire to about 140 houses in the village in the morning.

Property destruction: On 24 May 2024, in Gyoe Gyar Kan village (Madaya township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), about 80 military soldiers raided the village with four vehicles and set fire to some houses at around 8:30 am.

On 24 May 2024, in Moke Kha Mu village (Kyaikto township, Thaton district, Mon state), the military arrested a worker at a chicken farm and beat and interrogated him at the Kyaikto township police station. He was arrested as the military could not find the local PDF member and local PDF's farm-owner father, who escaped when the military arrived at the farm. The local PDF participated in the attack on the Taung Paing ward 100-household head on 22 May (coded separately).

On 24 May 2024, in Salin township (Minbu district, Magway region), the military advanced with five vehicles, conducted airstrikes, and fired artillery rounds indiscriminately at nearby villages, hitting and destroying a house and injuring an elderly woman.

actors: KNU/KNLA: Karen National Union/Karen National Liberation Army
notes: On 24 May 2024, in Hpapun township (Hpapun district, Kayin state), the military engaged in intense fighting with the KNLA. Casualties unknown.

actors: KNU/KNLA: Karen National Union/Karen National Liberation Army
notes: On 24 May 2024, near Mi Chaung Inn village (Kawkareik township, Kawkareik district, Kayin state), the military engaged in intense fighting with a combined force of the KNLA and their allied forces near the Daw Na old road. Casualties unknown.

actors: ULA/AA: United League of Arakan/Arakan Army
source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Khit Thit Media; Myanmar Pressphoto Agency; Narinjara News; Radio Free Asia
notes: On 24 May 2024, in Mrauk-U town (Mrauk-U township, Mrauk-U district, Rakhine state), the military conducted airstrikes by dropping a bomb on the district administration office in Htan Ma Rit ward, where Arakan Army members stationed, at around 9:40 am. Khit Thit Media reported that at least 6 Arakan Army members were killed. Another source, DVB reported that there were no casualties. Myanmar Pressphoto Agency also reported that a spokesperson from the AA claimed that the news about 6 Arakan Army members being killed was fake and that there were no casualties. Another source, Narinjara News reported that 2 locals nearby were injured.

actors: Police Forces of Myanmar (2021-) Prison Guards
notes: Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), in Kyaikmaraw town (Kyaikmaraw township, Mawlamyine district, Mon state), two female political prisoners, a 24-year-old and a 50-year-old, were sexually abused by the prison guards at two cells in the second floor of the prison building.
On 24 May 2024, citizens, including Ukrainian nationals, marched through Cetinje, expressing their solidarity for Ukrainian citizens and condemning the Russian aggression.

On 24 May 2024, rioters set up road blockades and clashed with gendarmerie and police forces in Dumbea (New Caledonia). Amid the riot, around 15 armed individuals assaulted two police officers. One of the police officers fired his gun, likely in self-defense, killing one of the rioters. The rioters demonstrated against the constitutional bill project to enlarge the citizen electoral body, opening it up to people who have lived in New Caledonia for at least 10 years. Participants argued the move would go against the interests of the pro-independence movement.

On 24 May 2024, victims of cooperatives, including members of the CPN(UML), NC, CPN(MC), and RPP, staged a protest rally in Bharatpur city (Chitwan district). The protesters expressed frustration over the slow response to their demands, including the return of their savings.

On 24 May 2024, protesters from the Madhesh Chure (hill range) region and students of environmental science staged a sit-in protest at Maitighar Mandala in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters were making various demands, including a stop to illegal encroachment and exploitation of the Chure (hill range) region.

On 24 May 2024, victims of cooperatives, led by the National Conservation Campaign of Cooperative Savings, staged a protest rally in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters were demanding the return of their savings and strict action against those responsible for embezzlement.

On 24 May 2024, police intervened by using force against protesters, including an activist and relatives of Nepalese recruited into the Russian army, who were staging a protest at the Consular Service Department at Tripureshwor locality in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters demanded protection for Nepali recruits in the Russian army, proper compensation for deceased soldiers, and clarification on the status of those missing.

On 24 May 2024, an unknown number of XR and Quit with Coal (Kappen met Kolen) activists set up tents in front of the province hall of Haarlem (Noord-Brabant) to demand the revocation of the permits granted to the company Tata Steel. According to the protesters, the company did not comply with the permit's conditions. The protesters called on the government to prioritize the health of local residents and the environment.

On 24 May 2024, an unknown number of XR and Quit with Coal (Kappen met Kolen) activists protested on a waterway lock in Wijk bij Duurstede (Utrecht), blocking access to it to a coal ship, to denounce coal production and its environmental impact.

On 24 May 2024, armed assailants (coded as TTP) abducted an employee of an NGO in Daraban area (Dera Ismail Khan, KPK) after taking the local staff hostage. The NGO was conducting a survey on post-flood damaged houses.
On 24 May 2024, BLA militants attacked a military check post and on ground patrol personnel in Kurmood area in Sibi tehsil (Sibi, Balochistan) using heavy weapons. Casualties unknown.

On 24 May 2024, BLF militants opened fire on trucks carrying minerals in Khad Koocha area (Mastung, Balochistan). The BLF claims to have released the drivers and owners of the vehicles, warning them against transporting minerals out of Balochistan. Baloch separatists have previously targeted trucks transporting resources from Balochistan to Punjab.

On 24 May 2024, BYC, NP, BNP-M members, residents, and civil society members staged a protest rally outside the press club in Dalbandin town (Chagai, Balochistan) against the suspected harassment by military personnel towards Baloch drivers on the Pakistan-Afghanistan border. It was claimed that military personnel had removed the shoes of Baloch individuals and forced them to stand on hot ground.

Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), the Papiki clan (coded as Papiki tribe) clashed with the Dapi clan (coded as Dapi tribe) in Dei district, Western Highlands (coded at Ruti ward, assuming the event happened within Kotna Rural LLG) resulting in the death of 4 people. The clash started after a Dapi man ended a relationship with a Papiki girl and married another girl. Police attended to the conflict between the two factions.

On 24 May 2024, farmers gathered for a demonstrative ride from the Siedlce direction to Zakret near Warsaw, demanding higher state support and protesting against the so-called Green Deal restrictions.

On 24 May 2024, students launched an occupational strike and a picket protest at their university premises in Warsaw, declaring their solidarity with civilians in Gaza and protesting against the ongoing military operations of Israel.

On 24 May 2024, around 120 Navigator workers held a protest in Lisboa (Lisboa), outside the hotel where the company's general meeting took place, to demand pay rises and a resumption of negotiations. The leader of CGT took part in the protest.

On 24 May 2024, people, including students, held a protest at the Faculty of Economy of the University of Porto in Porto (Porto), where a debate with the EIB president was taking place, to denounce the EIB's financing of Israel and accuse them of being complicit with the 'genocide' in Gaza. Some protesters shouted 'Free Palestine'.

On 24 May 2024, more than 20 people, called by CDU, held a protest in Santarem (Santarem) against the possible concession of the operations of the Santarem Municipal Market to private individuals, arguing that public management of the space was the one that most benefited business owners.

On 24 May 2024, students from Babes-Bolyai University and the Technical University of Cluj-Napoca set up a camp in the courtyard of the Faculty of Sociology and Social Assistance in Cluj-Napoca, demanding institutional accountability and immediate disinvestment from any entity profiting from the ongoing genocide in the Gaza Strip, a boycott of genocide and illegal occupation, transparency towards students and citizens, solidarity with Palestinian students, sanctions against racism and Islamophobia in the university, suspension of European research funds for projects that violate international legislation, and solidarity with students repressed by European universities.

On 24 May 2024, 9 DPP County Councilors from Yunlin held a press conference with placards at the Yunlin County Council in Douliu City (Yunlin). They criticized the KMT and TPP for abusing their power in forcing through a legislative power reform bill and urged Yunlin citizens to go to Taipei to protest for their democratic freedoms.

On 24 May 2024, 2 DPP legislators and one other held a press conference with placards in Taipei City (Taipei City). They demanded that the KMT restrain its legislators from resorting to violence after the Legislative Yuan incident that took place on May 17, and announced that they would be filing attempted murder charges against several KMT legislators.

On 24 May 2024, 2 DPP Taoyuan City councilors and others held a press conference with placards in Taoyuan City (Taoyuan City). They condemned the KMT and TPP for forcing through what they deemed an undemocratic reform bill, and announced that they would be going to Taipei to join protesters at the Legislative Yuan.

On 24 May 2024, 3 DPP Hualien County Councilors held a press conference with placards in Hualien City (Hualien City). They condemned the KMT and TPP for using undemocratic means to achieve their political goals, and demanded that they abide to established parliamentary procedures.

On 24 May 2024, over 20,000 people, including students, people from Hong Kong, and DPP Kaohsiung City councilors, gathered to protest with placards at Central Park in Kaohsiung City (Kaohsiung City). They criticized the KMT and TPP for abusing their power in forcing through a legislative power reform bill, declared that the KMT was acting undemocratically, and expressed their support for those protesting at the Legislative Yuan.

On 24 May 2024, 50-60 people, including teachers and a German national protested with placards in Taitung City (Taitung). They criticized the KMT and TPP for abusing their power in forcing through a legislative power reform bill and condemned such parties for acting undemocratically.

On 24 May 2024, people, including students and a former DPP Tainan City councilor gathered to protest with placards in Tainan City (Tainan City). They criticized the KMT and TPP for abusing their power in forcing through a legislative power reform bill, declared that the KMT was acting undemocratically, and expressed their support for those protesting at the Legislative Yuan.

On 24 May 2024, about 200 people, including students, elderly people, and a DPP Chiayi City councilor gathered to protest with placards in Chiayi City (Chiayi City). They criticized the KMT and TPP for abusing their power in forcing through a legislative power reform bill, declared that the KMT was acting undemocratically, and expressed their support for those protesting at the Legislative Yuan.

On 24 May 2024, about 500 people, including high school students and teachers, gathered to protest with placards at Changhua Station in Changhua City (Changhua). They criticized the KMT and TPP for abusing their power in forcing through a legislative power reform bill, declared that the KMT was acting undemocratically, and expressed their support for those protesting at the Legislative Yuan.

On 24 May 2024, almost 500 people gathered to protest with placards by the Taichung City government in Taichung City - Xitun district (Taichung City). They criticized the KMT and TPP for abusing their power in forcing through a legislative power reform bill, declared that the KMT was acting undemocratically, and demanded that Taiwan assert its sovereignty as an independent country.

On 24 May 2024, over 100,000 people gathered to protest with placards outside of the Legislative Yuan in Taipei City - Zhongzheng district (Taipei City). They criticized the KMT and TPP for abusing their power in forcing through a legislative power reform bill, and demanded that democracy be upheld.

On 24 May 2024, more than 30 people gathered to protest with placards in Magong City (Penghu). They criticized the KMT and TPP for abusing their power in forcing through a legislative power reform bill, and demanded that democracy be upheld.
