Around 24 May 2024 (as reported), Patriot Front Network 7 affiliates gathered in Acton (Massachusetts) to demonstrate with a banner that read 'Strong Families, Strong Nation' and promoted the group.

On 24 May 2024, a group of pro-Palestinian people, including high school students and Queer Youth for Palestine, gathered in front of the White House in Washington DC - National Mall (District of Columbia) to call for 'free Palestine' and an end to US funding for 'genocide' in Gaza. The event was a 'School Strike for Gaza' sponsored by American Muslims for Palestine, Occupation Free DC, and Teachers Against Genocide. People held signs that said 'Biden funds genocide.' The demonstration took place amid the Israel-Hamas war which began in October 2023.

On 24 May 2024, pro-Palestinian protesters and members of the Connecticut Palestine Alliance continued the 3-day 'Walk For Gaza' march from the office of U.S. Rep Jim Himes in Bridgeport (Connecticut) to demand that the U.S. end military and financial aid to Israel, call for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza, resume funding for the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees, and take part in the negotiations to release all hostages on both sides. The march took place amid the Israel-Hamas war which began in October 2023.

On 24 May 2024, hundreds of students walked out of class at schools across Houston (Texas) to protest against actions taken by Houston Independent School District (HISD) and the state-appointed superintendent Mike Miles, namely increased staff and teacher terminations. Students were joined at the protest by parents and community members after they walked out. Walkouts occurred at Carnegie Vanguard High School, Houston Academy for International Studies, Lanier Middle School, Meyerland Performing and Visual Arts Middle School, Heights High School, Westside High School, Energy Institute High School, Westbury High School, Debakey High School, Lamar High School, North Houston Early College, and the Mickey Leland College Preparatory Academy for Young Men.

On 24 May 2024, community members demonstrated outside of Assemblymember Sarahana Shrestha's office in Kingston (New York) to call for the passage of the Hudson Valley Power Authority Act which would allow a publicly-owned Hudson Valley Power Authority to purchase Central Hudson. Protesters claimed it would lead to lower rates. Assemblymember Sarahana Shrestha (D), state Sen. Michelle Hinchey (D), and Ulster County Executive Jen Metzger (D), as well as members of Communities for Local Power, the Mid-Hudson Valley Democratic Socialists of America, Beacon Climate Action Now, and professors joined the demonstration.

On 24 May 2024, a group of pro-Palestinian protesters, including college students and members of Mother's Organizing for Palestinian Solidarity, gathered outside Congressman Jodey Arrington's (R) office in downtown Lubbock (Texas) to demonstrate their support for Palestine, to demonstrate against the government of Israel, to call for a ceasefire, and to call for the congressman to oppose funding Israel amid the Israel-Hamas war which began in October 2023.

On 24 May 2024, more than 20 teachers, paraprofessionals, and students demonstrated at East Rock school building in New Haven (Connecticut) to demand that $220 million be allocated to the New Haven Public Schools' budget and a better students-staff ratio. The New Haven Federation of Teachers (part of AFT), Paraprofessionals union (AFT), Connecticut American Federation of State, County, and Municipal Employees (AFSCME Council 4), and Connecticut for All joined the rally.

On 24 May 2024, several migrant farm workers demonstrated at Hannaford headquarters in Scarborough (Maine) to call on the supermarket chain to join the 'Migrant Justice's Milk with Dignity Program' which would guarantee higher salaries, housing, and better working conditions.

On 24 May 2024, residents of the Kalabria neighborhood protested in front of the Municipality of Pristina for not including their neighborhood in the planned reconstruction discussion taking place that day. They claim that despite paying taxes and contributing to the municipal budget, they have no roads and scarce access to electricity and water.
Property destruction: On 23 May 2024, JWS members cut 38 olive trees and 10 walnut trees in Ukanli town in Aleppo countryside, in order to sell them in markets.

On 23 May 2024, at around 7:30 am Sanaa time, Houthi forces fired 2 anti-ship ballistic missiles targeting the Yannis general cargo ship (IMO: 9401910) in the Strait of Bab el Mandeb around 98 nm south of Al Hudaydah claiming that other ships from the company owning the targeted ship -- Eastern Mediterranean Maritime -- had docked at Israeli ports on 4 and 5 May. There were no fatalities or injuries as the missiles impacted the water in close proximity of the ship.

actors: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: On 23 May 2024, Algerian army soldiers conducted a military operation against AQIM in Djebel Tamoulga (Oued Fodda, Chlef) and killed 2 AQIM militants. They seized two AK-47 rifles and three magazines.

On 23 May 2024, in Rosario (Santa Fe), members of social organizations, including CCC, protested in front of the Municipality and later marched to the headquarters of the National Social Security Administration (ANSES) to demand food for soup kitchens.

On 23 May 2024, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 1 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), teachers from various unions demonstrated in front of Congress in defense of public education, salary improvements, and the restitution Fund. CTERA, UDA, AMET, SADOP, and the Confederation of Argentine Educators (CEA) called the mobilization.
On 23 May 2024, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 14 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), for the second consecutive day, hospital and private clinic workers protested, demanding salary improvements.
On 23 May 2024, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 2 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), for the second consecutive day, hospital and private clinic workers protested, demanding salary improvements.
On 23 May 2024, in Villa Maria (Cordoba), public workers protested in front of the Government Palace, demanding salary improvements.

On 23 May 2024, in Buenos Aires - Comuna 1 (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), social organization members protested to demand food for soup kitchens. Polo Obrero members also demonstrated in front of the former Ministry of Social Development. Members of UTEP, CCC, Barrios de Pie, FPDS, and Evita Movement also protested in front of the office of the Ministry of Human Capital in Barrio Norte, and members of MLS, whose organization was renamed 'Territories in Struggle,' protested in the vicinity of the obelisk for similar demands.

On 23 May 2024, in Corrientes (Corrientes), students, teachers, and members of unions, including ATE, protested to defend public education. The protesters demanded salary increases and more budget for universities.

source: El Diario de Carlos Paz; El Libertador; El Territorio; La Nacion (Argentina)
notes: On 23 May 2024, in Posadas (Misiones), teachers and health workers who demanded salary improvements tried to enter the Legislative Palace forcibly, breaking glass and damaging property. However, the Police stopped them with tear gas. Later, rioters moved to the governor's private house, where a police squad prevented them from access.

source: 14 February Revolution Youth Coalition; Bahrain Alyoum; Bahrain Mirror; LuaLua TV
notes: On 23 May 2024, demonstrators, including February 14 Youth Coalition, held a large protest march in Al Diraz (Northern) to commemorate the 7th anniversary of the 5 'martyrs' during the May 2017 Bahraini demonstration in Al Diraz.

On 23 May 2024, in Sacaba municipality (Cochabamba), a group of farmers and coca growers carried out a demonstration by starting a vigil demanding the right to commercialize coca leaf and defending their institutions and traditions.

On 23 May 2024, in La Paz (La Paz), a large group of youth supporters of the Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples: MAS-IPSP carried out a demonstration outside the Electoral Supreme Court demanding the legitimacy of the congress of their party held in May 2023, where a new president of the political movement was pronounced.

source: El Diario (Bolivia); La Patria en Linea; Los Tiempos (Bolivia); Opinion (Bolivia)
notes: On 23 May 2024, in Caihuasi (Oruro), around 200 international truck drivers carried out a demonstration by blocking the alternate road between Oruro, Cochabamba and La Paz departments demanding flow of dollars, fuel supply in the country, as well as the derogation of both, a decree (4732) that regulates real estate ownership and a customs law amendment (145), which according to demonstrators would allow local administration to seize their merchandise, affecting small business owners. The sector called a 48-hours strike as part of their demonstration.

On 23 May 2024, in Puente San Pablo (Beni), for a fourth consecutive day, a group of agriculture producers and now motorcycle riders as well, carried out a demonstration by blocking the main road to the municipality with a list demands to the national government, among them, the deployment of the gas service station in San Pablo community, bank loans, and the status on the construction of the Agro-Inputs Plant in the region.

On 23 May 2024, in Cochabamba (Cochabamba), dozens of locals from Bolivar province carried out a demonstration outside the governor's office demanding the resignation of a departmental representative (affiliated with Movement for Socialism-Political Instrument for the Sovereignty of the Peoples: MAS-IPSP) and demanding the designation of an alternate representative.

On 23 May 2024, in La Paz (La Paz), a group of people and members of the Revolutionary Humanist Action (AUR) social organization carried out a demonstration by marching through the main streets of La Paz protesting against an agreement from the World Health Organizations to regulate pandemics, arguing the resolution limits people's freedom and rights.

On 23 May 2024, in Rio de Janeiro - Central Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Estacio and Catumbi neighborhoods. Casualties unknown.

On 23 May 2024, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Gardenia Azul and Tijuca neighborhoods. Casualties unknown.

On 23 May 2024, in Ribeirao das Neves (Minas Gerais), two armed individuals invaded a child's party and opened fire against the guests. A man and two children were killed. Three more people were injured. The target of the attack was the fatal male victim, who was involved in drug trafficking activities. Police arrested one suspect, who was injured during the attack by friendly fire. The attack was motivated by a drug trafficking settling of scores. 3 fatalities.

On 23 May 2024, in Paty do Alferes (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters shot a councilman (PSC) four times in the head and killed him in the Lameirao neighborhood. Motivation and perpetrators unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, in Salvador - Centro (Bahia), two unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a teenage girl in the Barris neighborhood. The suspects fired against the victim when she was at a public square and escaped immediately. Also, a man was shot and injured by a stray bullet during the attack. Authorship and motivations for the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, in Lagoa Santa (Minas Gerais), a teenage boy, who was a drug trafficker, shot and killed his uncle in the Santos Dumont neighborhood. The victim had reported drug trafficking activities to the police, leading to the arrest of two of the perpetrator's brothers. Police detained the perpetrator. 1 fatality.

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Balneario Arroio do Silva (Santa Catarina), two men and a woman were killed and their bodies were found in the Vila Dona Isabel neighborhood. The male victims were tied up and had plastic bags over their heads. They had been missing since 4 May 2024. Police suspect their killings were motivated by drug trafficking disputes. 3 fatalities.

On 23 May 2024, in Extremoz (Rio Grande do Norte), four unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Campinas neighborhood. The suspects were on motorcycles when they fired against the victim and escaped immediately. Authorship and motivations for the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, in Recife (Pernambuco), unidentified armed individuals shot and killed a man in a drive-by shooting in the Boa Viagem neighborhood. The suspects were in a car when they fired against the victim and escaped immediately. Authorship and motivations for the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, an unidentified armed group clashed with Chadian defense forces near Haraze Mangueigne, Kouga-Tchad (Haraze Mangueigne, Salamat), following the armed group's assault on a transport vehicle. One person was killed and three others injured.

Looting: Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Alerce (Los Lagos), unidentified individuals broke into the Little Corner of Light kindergarten, stole office items, food and gas, and left two banners both criticizing the establishment's workers and stating that they had been sent by other unnamed individuals. The kindergarten's director accused the municipality of anti-union intimidation since she was due to intervene during a municipal council session on the same day regarding outstanding municipal debts.

On 23 May 2024, in Santiago - Providencia (Metropolitana), a small group pro-Palestine law students enrolled at the University of Chile occupied their faculty buildings both to demand that it cut all ties with Israeli counterparts due to the ongoing war against Hamas and to express solidarity with members of the Central Arts faculty due to poor infrastructure and working conditions there. Students voted on the following day to end the occupation.

On 23 May 2024, in Valdivia (Los Rios), teachers and students at the Austral University of Chile (UACh) marched inside the Isla Teja campus to protest against the dismissal of 23 academics for financial reasons. The march was called by the local Teachers' Union and obstetrics, music and audiovisual studies students had occupied their university buildings since the week prior.

source: Biobio Chile; El Mercurio (Chile); La Nacion (Chile); La Tercera (Chile)
notes: On 23 May 2024, in Santiago - Nunoa (Metropolitana), at least seven unidentified, hooded individuals suspected of being students threw Molotov cocktails and fireworks at a Transantiago bus and police officers near the Metropolitan University of Educational Sciences (UMCE; also close to the University of Chile's Juan Gomez Millas campus). The incendiary devices set on fire the bus, which was extinguished by police using a water cannon. There were no injured or arrested, and the reason for the violence was unclear (although students across Santiago frequently engage in anti-government mobilization without explicitly stating so).

On 23 May 2024, in Santiago - Providencia (Metropolitana), students enrolled at the Liceo Jose Victorino Lastarria school erected incendiary barricades outside the establishment. School authorities described the event as a violent demonstration, but claimed the students had no particular claims. Nevertheless, students across Santiago frequently engage in anti-government mobilization without explicitly stating so.

Movement of forces: On 23 May 2024, in a rural area of Tibu municipality (Norte de Santander), Venezuelan military forces were present in the San Luis Beltran vereda, where they approached civilians and targeted them with their weapons. The military forces also took down a sign saying 'Welcome to Colombia.'

Additionally, rioters entered the campus and threw explosive devices from the campus roof buildings against police officers. Anti-disturbance officers responded by throwing tear gas against rioters. The reason for the demonstration is unknown. There was another demonstration on the south campus (coded separately).

Officers threw tear gas against rioters to disperse them from the area while rioters threw explosive devices against officers (likely Molotov). The reason for the demonstration is the designation of UNAL's new rector. There were no casualties.

Security measures: On 23 May 2024, in the Guacari municipality (Valle del Cauca), the local government declared a curfew for minors from 9 p.m. to 5 a.m. the next day, as well as banning parking in nearby public buildings and the temporary closing of the road between Guacari and the Sonso corregimiento starting at 6 p.m. to prevent attacks from FARC dissidents and other armed groups.

On 23 May 2024, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), teachers from the Galapa, Puerto Colombia, and Barranquilla carried out a sit-in in front of the Fiduprevisora to protest against the bad implementation of the new health system. The sit-in has continued for three consecutive days.

On 23 May 2024, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), six unidentified individuals shot and injured a man while he was hospitalized in the Mediclinica, located in the 47 road with 80 street. The victim had been sentenced to prison for homicide years prior. The attackers were dressed as police officers. There were two other people killed during the attack. 2 fatalities.

On 23 May 2024, in Bogota - Bosa (Bogota, D.C.), rioters (likely students) attacked a public bus with sticks and rocks and tried to set it on fire near the Universidad Distrital south campus. Anti-disturbance officers made presence in the area. The reason for the demonstration is unknown. There was another demonstration on the Vivero campus (coded separately). There were no casualties.

source: Comores Infos; France Info - Outre-mer La Premiere

On 23 May 2024, in Santiago de Puriscal, San Jose, seven unidentified hooded individuals entered the offices of the Ministry of Environment and Energy (MINAE) to steal several vehicles belonging to the institution and electronic devices. They beat the security guard, tied him and took his gun and escaped with the stolen property. Five vehicles were stone. Some version suggested that arms were stolen, but other reports deny this information.

On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad Quesada, Alajuela, a group of parents demonstrated by closing the gates of the San Luis de la Tesalia school in San Carlos, to demand the removal of a security officer and the principal. According to the protesters, they made this decision because the principal spends a lot of time on sick leave and the guard is taking attributions that do not belong to him.

ENDF claimed to have killed 3 Fano leaders and several other militants. Unspecified fatalities mentioned coded as 3. Total fatalities coded as 6. Several other militants were also injured.

notes: Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), ENDF in a joint military operation with regional government forces (likely Oromia regional police and Kebele militias, due to their participation in related operations in the area) clashed with OLF-OLA in an unspecified location (coded to Galesa) in Jeldu woreda (West Shewa, Oromia). ENDF claimed that an unspecified number of OLF-OLA members peacefully surrendered amid the pressure of its joint military campaigns against the group. Casualties unknown.

actors: OLF-OLA: Oromo Liberation Army-Oromo Liberation Front
notes: Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), ENDF in a joint military operation with regional government forces (likely Oromia regional police and Kebele militias, due to their participation in related operations in the area) clashed with OLF-OLA in an unspecified location (coded to the admin center, Chobi) in Cobi woreda (West Shewa, Oromia). ENDF claimed that an unspecified number of OLF-OLA members peacefully surrendered amid the pressure of its joint military campaigns against the group. Casualties unknown.

On 23 May 2024, Fano claimed to have clashed with ENDF, Amhara State police, and the kebele militia in Kon town (Wadla, North Wello, Amhara). Fano briefly controlled the town and took members of the Kebele militia and Amhara state police to an unknown place. There is no further information available. Casualties unknown.

source: EBC; Oromia Broadcasting Network; Oromiya Media Network
notes: On 23 May 2024, female members of the House of People's Representatives and Oromia regional council, Caffee Oromiya, and Hada Sinqe, Oromo traditional woman leaders, staged a sit-in in front of the regional council, Caffe Oromia, in Mesqel Square, Kirkos, Addis Ababa (region 14, Addis Ababa), and called for the OLF-OLA and the government to opt for peace as the Oromo people have the tradition of resolving conflict. The participants urged the warring parties to stop the fighting that they say is affecting a large number of women and children.

Looting: Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), Fano militia looted one V8 Toyota vehicle in Bahir Dar (Bahir Dar town, West Gojam, Amhara). ENDF seized the vehicle from Fano in Dagi Kebele in Debub Mecha Woreda (coded separately).

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in San Pedro Sula, Cortes, a man was killed and his body was found dismembered in a sack lying in the Reparto Lempira neighborhood. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.
On 23 May 2024, in Yoro, Yoro, a group of employees took over the facilities of the Yoro Judicial Palace in protest demanding more judges in the municipality to work on pending cases.
On 23 May 2024, in Choloma, Cortes, a group of residents took to the streets and gathered in the basement of the municipality to protest after suffering a power outage that lasted for 13 hours.

On 23 May 2024, outside Olanchito, Yoro, two armed men killed a mother and her two daughters with machetes inside their home in the community of Brisas de Jaguaca. Reports revealed that two of the victims were also sexually assaulted before being killed. The two perpetrators have been arrested following the killing. The hypothesis of a robbery has been ruled out. 3 fatalities.
On 23 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince - Gressier, Ouest, police forces clashed with gang members in the commune. Casualties unknown.

Around 23 May 2024 (week of), in Port-au-Prince - Carrefour, Ouest, members of the Living-Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) attacked the Carrefour police station. Casualties unknown.

source: Alterpresse; Gazette Haiti; Haiti Press Network; Le Nouvelliste; Loop News Haiti; Rezo Nodwes
notes: On 23 May 2024, in Bon Repos, Ouest, members of the Living Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) moving in three trucks ambushed three Evangelical missionaries (a US woman, a US man, and a Haitian woman) who were travelling in a vehicle with their children. The attack happened moments after the victims had left a church in the Lizon neighbourhood, in La Plaine du Cul-de-Sac area. The gang members beat up the man and forced him to drive them to his home, where the three missionaries were killed. The property was looted. The victims used to work at the Bon Espoir orphanage. The US citizens were the daughter and son-in-law of a local politician from Missouri (US). 3 fatalities.

Other: Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, the leaders of the Kraze Barye Gang (a.k.a. Vitelhomme Gang) and the Base 5 Secondes Gang (a.k.a. Village de Dieu Gang) claimed to have allied each other to form a 'security unit'.

On 23 May 2024, local farmers held a rally near Hashtrud City (East Azerbaijan) to protest against sand-washing workshops around their villages near the Qaranquchai River and endangering agricultural lands. Police arrested at least five farmers.

On 23 May 2024, Iraqi police forces arrested a narcotics smuggler who is also a member of an unspecified intelligence agency (coded as police) in possession of unspecified large quantities of crystal meth, captagon pills, and a hand grenade at a checkpoint in Ramadi City (Al Anbar).

On 23 May 2024, prisoners started a riot that involved burning their blankets in the Nadhran juvenile detention center in Al Basrah province (coded to Basrah). The reasons behind the riot were not reported. There were no casualties.

No direct hits were reported, as the rockets fell in open areas, some near Kiryat Shmona.

notes: On 23 May 2024, about 300 ultra-orthodox Haredi Jews demonstrated in Jerusalem (Judean Mountains) against the conscription law that could end their exemption from military service. Demonstrators blocked the light rail and traffic on the roads. Demonstrators shouted 'we will die and not enlist' and called police forces 'Nazis.' Demonstrators threw objects at police and clashed with police forces. Police used mounted officers and water cannons to disperse demonstrators. 2 demonstrators were arrested.

notes: On 23 May 2024, about 1,200 residents from the north held a protest at a junction near Amiad (Zefat, HaZafon). Protesters established a sit-in they named 'Galilee Displaced Persons Camp' in protest against the government and their inaction in addressing the economic and security needs of northern residents. Protesters called on the government to take action to bring an end to the Hezbollah attacks in northern Israel. Local mayors of northern towns and government MKs attended the protest.

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), a mob killed and burned a suspected thief in Linthipe (Dedza, Central).

On 23 May 2024, striking judiciary support workers gathered outside of the High Court in Blantyre (Blantyre City, Southern) to call for a government review of their salaries. Armed police disrupted the demonstration and removed the tree branches that workers had used to block an entrance to the High Court.

On 23 May 2024, in Tecate, Baja California, unknown number of armed individuals shot and killed a woman inside a car in Colonia Lazaro Cardenas. Next to the victim a message signed by El Colorado of the CAF (Tijuana Cartel) was left threatening 'the people of Alvo Kando and cabezon'. 1 fatality.
Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Tijuana, Baja California, a person was killed and the body was found wrapped in bags with the hands and feet tied up in Cuesta Blanca. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, in Tijuana, Baja California, women workers from a gas station company demonstrated at the El Soler station to ask the authorities for solutions to the fuel shortage caused by a blockade on the Pemex plant which began on May 19 (coded separately). The demonstrators denounced that they are suffering economic repercussions due to the closing of gas stations.

On 23 May 2024, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, workers from the Chiapas High School College, members of the Single Independent Union of the Chiapas High School College (SUICOBACH) started a strike and held a protest against the lack of response from the educational authorities to resolve their labor demands.

On 23 May 2024, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, teachers from the SNTE and CNTE took over the Pemex facilities and blocked the communication route to the plant to demand that the authorities be heard to discuss various issues, including the possible repeal of the education reform.. The protesters announced that they would not leave until they were listened to by the federal and state authorities.

On 23 May 2024, in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, a group of Morena party members attacked PAN members who were outside Expo Chihuahua waiting for the arrival of their candidate. The rioters used water bottles and flag sticks to attack the PAN members. A young PAN member was knocked down and beaten to the ground by three Morena members leaving him injured.

On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Benito Juarez, Morena supporters demonstrated for an hour in front of the PAN national headquarters. The demonstrators burned electoral propaganda and shouted slogans.

On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Benito Juarez, members of the CNTE demonstrated in front of the MC and PAN national headquarters to demand the abrogation of the Education Reform and to show their disagreement with the 10% salary increase proposed by the authorities.

On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, around 100 teachers from the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) blocked the entrance and exit to the Morena party offices. The teachers painted the entrance door with graffiti. The teachers asked for a greater budget for education, decent pensions and the repeal of the education law. Similarly, members of the CNTE demonstrated in front of the PRI national headquarters to demand the abrogation of the Education Reform and to show their disagreement with the 10% salary increase proposed by the authorities. Headquarters personnel had to intervene with fire extinguishers to put out a fire caused by the burning of electoral propaganda by the demonstrators.

On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, members of the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) locked down the National director of Morena at the facilities of the party. The demonstration coincided with a press conference. The national president of Morena tried to dialogue with the teachers but was quickly overtaken by the teachers who did not let him out. The rioters shouted slogans saying that MORENA did not offered solution and represented the same problems of all politicians.

On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, a group of relatives of people in prison marched from the Chamber of Deputies to the Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation (SCJN) to demand that their cases be reviewed. The protesters claimed that they have been unfairly accused.

On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, members of the National Democratic Union of Workers of the Ministry of Culture (SNDTSC) started a sit-in in the vicinity of the Secretariat of Culture to demand salary increases, labor improvements and a response from authorities from government agencies to resolve their demands.

On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Miguel Hidalgo, members of the CNTE demonstrated in front of the PVEM and PRD national headquarters to demand the abrogation of the Education Reform and to show their disagreement with the 10% salary increase proposed by the authorities.

On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Tlalpan, dozens of teachers members of the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) demonstrated in front of the facilities of the National Electoral Institute (INE) accusing excessive expenses in electoral matters. The teachers blocked Viaducto-Tlalpan and burned electoral propaganda.

On 23 May 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, a man was shot dead by two armed men in Colonia Brisas del Campestre. The perpetrators arrived on a motorcycle, and the victim tried to flee, but one of the men chased him and shot him. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, in Leon de los Aldama, Guanajuato, two armed men on a motorcycle chased and shot a man in Colonia La Morena (drive-by). The victim tried to run away when he saw the men arrive on a motorcycle. 1 fatality.
Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a man was killed and his body was found dismembered inside a pot of food in colonia Juan R. Escudero. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, four men and a woman were shot and killed by two armed men in front of a store located in the Diana market in Fraccionamiento Magallanes. The woman was a store worker. A man was also injured. 5 fatalities, 1 injured.

Non-violent activity: On 23 May 2024, in San Jeronimo Palantla, Guerrero, members of the Nahuas Indigenous militia and the CIPOG-EZ Indigenous organization took over the control and security of the community after member of Los Ardillos tried to control the area. The event comes after an armed clash that took place the day before (coded separately).

On 23 May 2024, in San Jeronimo Palantla, Guerrero, for the second consecutive day, three hundred members of Nahua Indigenous militia from Nuevo Amanecer community of the CIPOG-EZ attacked the community of San Jeronimo Palantla and clashed with fifty armed individuals from the community. The members of the Nuevo Amanecer community were also affiliated with the CIPOEG-EZ Indigenous organization, who accuse the San Jeronimo community of having links with the Los Ardillos gang. The attack followed an attack by residents of San Jeronimo Palantla on Nuevo Amanecer on the same day. According to a representative of the CIPOG-EZ, the attack was a response to the inaction of the authorities in the face of the attacks being suffered by residents of Nuevo Amanecer by community members of San Jeronimo Palantla. During the two-day clashes three vehicles, three houses and a police station were set on fire. The clashes began on May 22 (coded separately) and ended on May 23. There were no casualties.

source: El Sol de Acapulco; Zeta Tijuana
notes: Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Iguala de la Independencia, Guerrero, three people were killed and their bodies were found with their hands tied up, gunshot wounds, tape in their faces, and a message signed by a criminal group in Colonia Yohuala. The victims are suspected to be members of a group of robbers and car thieves operating in the municipality. 3 fatalities.

On 23 May 2024, in Tepatepec, Hidalgo, about 200 students marched in front of the Municipal Palace of Francisco I. Madero as a protest against a school eviction in El Meche Normal school. The demonstrators carried banners and denounced that the cession would negatively affect their studies.

On 23 May 2024, in El Salto, Jalisco, a man was kidnapped by unidentified armed men. He was killed hours later and his body was found in Colonia El Terrero. The victim was the father of a ministerial police officer. According to the investigations, the event could be related to a clash that occurred a day before in Union de San Antonio municipality (coded separately). 1 fatality.

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Guadalajara, Jalisco, two men were killed and their body were found dismembered inside bags with their hands tied up and tape around their faces in Colonia Loma Linda. 2 fatalities.

On 23 May 2024, in Naucalpan de Juarez, Mexico, students and teachers from the CCH Naucalpan campus marched to demand justice for the dead of a student. The demonstration turned violent after some teachers were attacked by a group of students who showed up with sticks and stones outside the school facilities.

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Apatzingan de la Constitucion, Michoacan, rival armed groups clashed and left the body of a death man who was half-naked in colonia El Varillero. The victim had signs of having received some medical attention. 1 fatality.

Around 23 May 2024 (month of), in San Agustin del Maiz, Michoacan, a woman was killed and her body was found in an advanced state of decomposition with gunshot wounds and inside a bag on the roads of Morelia-Salamanca/Mexico-Guadalajara highway. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, in Morelia, Michoacan, for the second day in a row, members of the Union of Workers at the Service of the Executive Branch (Staspe) blocked around 11 roads around the city center to demand the dismissal of the head of the Forestry Commission of Michoacan (Cofom) after his government is ignoring their requests.

On 23 May 2024, in Uruapan, Michoacan, members of the community of Caltzontzin blocked Boulevard Industrial, near the Social Reintegration Center (Cereso) to demand that the authorities search for two 11-year-old girls who are missing.

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Uruapan, Michoacan, a pair of armed individuals on a motorcycle chased and shot at a man in a car on the old road to Tejerias (drive-by). In Colonia Tierra y Libertad, the victim lost control of his vehicle after running into the perpetrators and crashed into a store. The victim was unharmed, and one of the perpetrators was injured and arrested. 1 injured.
On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad Apodaca, Nuevo Leon, according to witnesses, armed men shot at a group of people. One young boy was killed in colonia Los Robles. 1 fatality.
On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad Apodaca, Nuevo Leon, two men were shot and killed by an unknown number of armed individuals on a motorcycle (drive-by) in Colonia Portal de Santa Rosa. 2 fatalities.

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Benito Juarez, Nuevo Leon, a man was killed and his body was found dismembered inside two bags between colonias Vistas del Seminario and San Francisco. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, in Oaxaca de Juarez, Oaxaca, for the second day in a row, teachers from the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) blocked the bus ADO terminal in Colonia Reforma to reject the ISSSTE (Social Security) law and the entire educational reform. The participants also took over the headquarters of the Local Council of the National Electoral Institute (INE) and stated that they will not allow the elections until their demands are met. The teachers replicated this event in other areas on the state (coded separately).

On 23 May 2024, in San Bartolo Coyotepec, Oaxaca, for the second day in a row, teachers from the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) took access of Ciudad Judicial to reject the ISSSTE (Social Security) law and the entire educational reform. The teachers replicated this event in other areas on the state (coded separately).

On 23 May 2024, in Tlalixtac de Cabrera, Oaxaca, for the second day in a row, teachers from the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) took over the Ciudad Administrativa to reject the ISSSTE (Social Security) law and the entire educational reform. The teachers replicated this event in other areas on the state (coded separately).

On 23 May 2024, in Ignacio Zaragoza, Puebla, an activist of the Green Ecologist Party of Mexico (PVEM) and collaborator of the candidate for the municipal presidency of Chilchotla was shot and killed by unidentified armed individuals. There are two versions, one is that he was killed by a member of the PSI party after the victim was given away money to favor the vote towards his party, which resulted in a discussion and later his killing. Another version, is that the candidate of the PVEM was being attacked and he was killed as a collateral incident. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, two men were shot dead by two armed men on a motorcycle (drive-by) in Colonia Santa Cruz Buenavista. One of the victims was a former public employee who worked in the Puebla Search for Persons Commission under the previous government and was accused of supposedly embezzling funds from the Commission. 2 fatalities.
On 23 May 2024, in San Luis Rio Colorado, Sonora, a man was shot and injured by several armed individuals in his house in Colonia Libertad. 1 injured.

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Chichicapa, Tabasco, a person was killed and human remains were found dismembered with a message inside a bag. The message warned that the victim could be the killer of a 12-year-old boy who was killed in the center of Paraiso. The bag had only the arms and legs of the victim. The rest of the body was found in Palo Quemado in Comalcalco municipality.

region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 23 May 2024, in Amatlan de los Reyes, Veracruz, armed men travelling in two vehicles kidnapped a man in the city center. The victim's whereabouts are unknown.

region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 23 May 2024, in Minatitlan, Veracruz, two armed individuals shot at a mechanic shop in Colonia Agustin Melgar. The workers took shelter and no one was injured. Some customers claimed that parts that the work was not being done properly and that workers of the workshop have stolen parts, although it is not known if this is related to the attack. There were no casualties.

region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 23 May 2024, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz, for the second day in a row, workers from the Ministry of Health went on strike and held a protest to demand the withdrawal of financial discounts, work risk payments, respect and compliance with general working conditions. Authorities arrived to the protest and tried to ask for their IDs. The workers accused intimidation by the authorities.

region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 23 May 2024, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz, farmers from the municipality of Misantla held a protest to demand compliance with the protection trials that they have won before the state and federal agrarian authorities.

region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: On 23 May 2024, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz, members of the 'Network in Memory and Struggle of Murdered and Missing Journalists', along with relatives of journalists who were victims of killing demonstrated in Plaza Lerdo in front of the Government Palace to demand justice.

region: Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave
notes: Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Xico, Veracruz, a man was killed and his body was found dismembered. Only an arm, a foot and the head were found around El Coconal area. 1 fatality.
On 23 May 2024, unidentified gunmen abducted a merchant in the village of Margou (Youwarou, Mopti).

On 23 May 2024, the Moroccan army launched a drone strike targeting Polisario militias in the South of Mijek, Mijik (Oued Ed-Dahab, Eddakhla-Oued Eddahab), resulting in an unspecified number of militants being killed. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3.

On 23 May 2024, thousands of healthcare workers held a sit-in protest in front of the parliament in Rabat, Hassan (Rabat, Rabat-Sale-Kenitra) to protest the delay in finalizing an agreement with the government that would lead to a salary increase.

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), LYDEC water and electricity company retirees and workers staged a sit-in protest in Casablanca, Sidi Belyout (Casablanca, Casablanca-Settat), calling for an increase in their pensions and salaries.
On 23 May 2024, street vendors held a sit-in protest in front of the wilaya of Marrakech, Gueliz (Marrakech, Marrakech-Safi), to protest delays in the completion of a market.
On 23 May 2024, students and their parents staged a sit-in protest in front of a private school in Agadir (Souss-Massa) to denounce an increase of tuitions fees.
Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), residents staged a sit-in in Ait Boulmane, Foum Jemaa (Azilal, Beni Mellal-Khenifra) to denounce their marginalization.

On 23 May 2024, Renamo supporters invaded the party headquarters and beat the head of Renamo's provincial mobilization in Marromeu (Marromeu, Sofala) as the man collected signatures in support of the Renamo president's candidacy. The man was admitted to a hospital. The group tore up signatures for the re-elected president and other documents.

On 23 May 2024, a group of about 30 Renamo supporters marched to Renamo head office in Maputo (Maputo City, Maputo) and returned objects such as membership cards, flags and Renamo t-shirts in repudiation of the re-election of the party president.

On 23 May 2024, the police and the Ajaokuta defence militia clashed with a Kogi militia in the Ajaokuta area, coded as Ajaokuta (Ajaokuta, Kogi). The police were on a rescue mission to release the five people abducted by the militia on 17 May 2024 (coded separately) when they clashed with the militia. The militia fled, and the police rescued the hostages. There were no fatalities.

On 23 May 2024, suspected Fulani pastoralists ambushed and opened fire on some Benue MPs in the Tyomu community along the Gboko/Makurdi highway, coded to Makurdi (Makurdi, Benue). The lawmakers were in transit, returning from a public hearing, when they were ambushed. The legislatures escaped the attack. There were no fatalities.

On 23 May 2024, an unidentified armed group shot and killed seven people in the Ugya community (Toto, Nassarawa). The victims included a mother and her 6-year-old child. The assailants also set three vehicles ablaze, vandalized some shops and carted away foodstuffs, drugs and other valuables.

source: Daily Leadership (Nigeria); Daily Trust (Nigeria); Nigeria Punch; Sun (Nigeria)
notes: On 23 May 2024, the pro- and anti-Ganduje APC factions clashed at the party headquarters in Wuse (Abuja Municipal, FCT) after the anti-Ganduje faction demonstrated against Ganduje's chairmanship of the party. There were numerous agitations against Umar Ganduje as the APC chairman, but some aggrieved party members descended on the anti-Ganduje in this round.

On 23 May 2024, hundreds of APC supporters marched from GRA junction to the APC office in Port Harcourt (Port Harcourt, Rivers), demonstrating their support for President Tinubu and his Renewed Hope policies. They also urged the FCT minister to join their party to help the President win the 2027 election as he did in 2023.

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), the Oro ethnic youths protested in Oron (Oron, Akwa Ibom) over repeated abduction incidents and insecurity in the area. They demanded the state government to issue a press statement on the state of insecurity in the area.

On 23 May 2024, in Cocle, Cocle, members of the Single National Union of Construction and Related Workers (Suntracs) demonstrated by blocking streets in San Andres area in response to the closure of 18 bank accounts held at the Savings Bank. This was part of a demonstration that occurred in different places of the country.

On 23 May 2024, in Panama City municipality, Panama, members of the Single National Union of Construction and Related Workers (Suntracs) demonstrated by blocking streets in response to the closure of 18 bank accounts held at the Savings Bank. They blocked different areas of the capital such as Corredor Sur, 5 de Mayo, Llano Bonito, Santa Maria and Howard. This was part of a demonstration that occurred in different places of the country.

On 23 May 2024, in Chimbote (Ancash), a group of teachers, who are members of the Union of Education workers at Peru (SUTEP), carried out a demonstration by marching through the main streets of the city demanding the fulfillment of an agreement reached with the regional government regarding an increase in their salaries and demanding better food for the students, internet connection in the schools and computers. Demonstrators called a 24-hours strike as part of their demonstration.

On 23 May 2024, in Huancayo (Huancayo), a group of health care workers from diverse areas carried out a demonstration outside a local hospital repudiating the new changes on the on-call schedule for their sector and denouncing low salaries in comparison with their work hours.

On 23 May 2024, in Puno (Puno), groups of teachers from different localities in the region gathered to demonstration by marching through the main streets of the city demanding the fulfillment of an agreement reached with the regional government regarding an increase in their salaries and in defense of public and free education.

On 23 May 2024, in Piura (Piura), around 600 teachers members of the Union of Education workers at Peru: SUTEP carried out a demonstration by marching through the main streets of the city demanding the fulfillment of an agreement reached with the regional government regarding an increase in their salaries, better infrastructure in schools, among others. On 23 May 2024, in Pucallpa (Ucayali), more than 600 teachers members of the Union of Education workers at Peru: SUTEP gathered outside the regional administration to demonstrate demanding the fulfillment of an agreement reached with the regional government regarding an increase in their salaries and better working conditions. On 23 May 2024, in San Vicente de Canete (Lima), a group of teachers members of the Union of Education workers at Peru: SUTEP gathered at Plaza de Armas square to demonstrate demanding the fulfillment of an agreement reached with the regional government regarding an increase in their salaries. On 23 May 2024, in Tacna (Tacna), around 200 active and pensioners teachers members of the Union of Education workers at Peru: SUTEP and the National Teachers Union: FENATEPERU carried out a demonstration by marching through the main streets of the city demanding the fulfillment of an agreement reached with the regional government regarding an increase in their salaries, better pension payments, and in defense of public and free education. On 23 May 2024, in Huanuco (Huanuco), a group of locals from Leoncito Prado municipality carried out a demonstration by marching through the main city demanding the regional government to complete different infrastructure projects in their municipality such as, drinking water service, bridges, sewage system, hospital, among other public services.

The suspect resisted authority, initiated a shooting, was injured in the gunfire, and pronounced dead in hospital. There was an arrest warrant for the deceased for homicide, drug-trafficking, and fraud; he was carrying fake ID papers at the time of his killing. Police collected a gun. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, in Ciudad Ojeda (Zulia), two unidentified crime group suspects shot and killed the owner of the Licoreria Macho Ibarra liquor store, in a suspected extortion-related attack in those premises occurred during the evening. The perpetrators arrived on a motorcycle, simulated being customers, and then shot the victim at least six times before fleeing. Relatives of the deceased were present at the time of the attack but they came out unscathed. The business owner had received several extortion threats since 2022. 1 fatality.

On 23 May 2024, in Coro (Falcon), a small group of relatives, mostly women, of six prisoners of the Federacion municipality CICPC police jail protested to demand their transfer back to the Coro CICPC police jail, the restoration of their prison visits, and access to medicines, and against the abuses they claim these prisoners have suffered in the Churuguara CICPC police jail. These six inmates initiated a hunger-strike earlier that week. The protesters gathered outside the Public Ministry Office, where they handed in a letter with their demands.

On 23 May 2024, attendees of Houthi summer camps held a Houthi-sponsored demonstration in Dhamar city (Dhamar) in solidarity with the Palestinian people and to denounce the 'crimes of the Israeli aggression' in the context of the latest round of violence in Israel-Palestine.

The military took them to Kamaing town around 5 am, asked to inform them about KIA/PDF troops and threatened to attack the village with heavy weapons if the military was attacked by resistance troops. They were released on the same day around 12 pm.

At least 6 security personnel were injured in the incident.

Other: On 23 May 2024, Alyaksandr Lukashenka appointed major general Pavel Muraveika as head of Belarus's general staff (coded to Minsk (Leninskiy, Minsk)). Muraveika was one of the first Belarusian officials to confirm Belarusian forces' presence in Ukraine back in 2022 and has threatened to use force to overtake the Suwalki Gap.

On 23 May 2024, pro-Palestinian students staged a rally and maintained their encampment with about 40 tents near the science building at the University of Quebec's campus in Montreal - Center East (Quebec) in support of Palestine, to demand that their university divest from Israeli companies and an academic boycott of Israeli universities. This was the 12th day of a campus demonstration after the arrest of student demonstrators at Columbia University in New York on 18 April. The University of Quebec filed for an injunction against pro-Palestinian protesters and asked the Quebec Superior Court to prohibit protesters from setting up tents and other material within three meters of campus buildings. A separate pro-Palestinian student encampment also took place at McGill University's campus. This demonstration was held amid the Israel-Hamas war, which began in October 2023.

On 23 May 2024, around 100 pro-Palestinian students staged a rally and maintained their encampment with dozens of tents at the University of Toronto's campus at the center of King's College Circle in Toronto - Old Toronto (Ontario) in support of Palestine, to demand that their university divest from Israeli companies and an academic boycott of Israeli universities. This was the 22nd day of a campus demonstration after the arrest of student demonstrators at Columbia University in New York on 18 April. The University of Toronto issued a trespass notice to the pro-Palestinian encampment to clear out by May 27 and then the University will consider disclosure and divestment. This campus demonstration was held amid the Israel-Hamas war, which began in October 2023.

On 23 May 2024, a small group of protesters held a rally during a press conference of Barrie's mayor in Barrie (Ontario) to protest against the city policies, including increasing police presence in downtown. Demonstrators claim that the policy changes would be harmful to homeless people and those with drug addictions.

On 23 May 2024, CUPE Ontario Home and Community Care Support Service members rallied outside MPP Todd Smith's office in Belleville (Ontario) to demand a fair wage increase and an investment in staffing.

On 23 May 2024, AUPE members and supporters held a rally outside Park Place Senior Living Devonshire in Edmonton (Alberta) to demand better care for children and families and to protest a proposal that would reduce work hours.

On 23 May 2024, around 200 students at Cure-Antoine-Labelle High School rallied outside their school in Laval (Quebec) to protest what they call a 'sexist dress code' after suspending approximately 50 girl students for wearing too short shorts at the school.

On 23 May 2024, members from various unions, including the Public Service Alliance of Canada (PSAC), the Professional Institute of the Public Service of Canada (PIPSC), the Union of Safety and Justice Employees (USJE), and the Canadian Association of Professional Employees (CAPE), rallied in front of Ottawa City Hall during mayor's breakfast event in Ottawa (Ontario) to protest against the 'federal government's decision to increase public servants' required office presence.'
