Balkar Bains, Secretary-Treasurer of Unifor's Ontario Regional Council, attended the rally.

On 23 May 2024, police officers intervened and convinced several dozen protesters blocking access to the HEAD campus to leave the site in Geneva (Geneve). The protest had started the previous day to express solidarity with the Palestinian people, condemn what they deemed an Israeli 'genocide' of Gazans, and demand Swiss universities to stop cooperating with Israeli universities.

On 23 May 2024, Turkish Cypriot livestock breeders and animal producers from across Northern Cyprus demonstrated for a fourth day in Northern Nicosia with their tractors and agricultural vehicles over the government's livestock policies and particularly the decision to import meat from the Netherlands. They also accused the government of corruption and fraud. They returned to their parked vehicles and set alight tires and hay bales. KTAMS threatened a general strike. The farmers brought kid goats, left watermelons in front of the Prime Minister's office and threw eggs and watermelons at the Ministry of Public Works and Transport building. Leaders and representatives of CTP, MDP and Independence Road, joined the action and made statements.

actors: Police Forces of the Czech Republic (2021-)
notes: On 23 May 2024, activists gathered in Prague, protesting against the ongoing pre-election meeting of the SPD party, criticizing especially their pro-Russian position regarding the ongoing war in Ukraine. Three of them were detained for attempts to pelt eggs at the podium.

On 23 May 2024, on the occasion of the 75th anniversary of the German Basic Law and at the call of a human rights activist and the GFA 'Basic Law for everyone' initiative (Grundgesetz fur alle), around 40 people gathered outside the Berliner Ensemble in Berlin - Mitte (Berlin), demanding a more inclusive approach to sexual identity within the constitution, calling for an expansion of Article 3 Paragraph 3 of the German Basic Law.

On 23 May 2024, around 60 left-wing activists, including Antifa affiliates, gathered outside the 'Mutter Wittig' restaurant in Bochum (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to protest against a meeting of JA affiliates at the venue. The police physically intervened to prevent clashes between the demonstrators and the meeting's participants. A member of JA later said that a tire of his car had been slashed, something the police were investigating at the time of reporting.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of a coalition of unions, teaching associations, and parents' and students' representatives, around 200 to 400 people gathered in Bremen (Bremen) to protest against the current education policy, calling for a 'shift in education' during the Youth and Family Ministers' Conference. The event highlighted issues such as staff shortages and the lack of educational opportunities.
On 23 May 2024, at the call of IG-BAU, over 1,000 people from the construction industry gathered in Dusseldorf (Nordrhein-Westfalen), demanding higher wages amid inflation.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of the IG-BAU, Ver.di and the DGB, around 300 workers gathered at the highway construction site in Hannover (Niedersachsen) to demand higher wages after the employers' side rejected an arbitration.
On 23 May 2024, several hundred students from the Albert-Schweitzer high school gathered in Hurth (Nordrhein-Westfalen) to protest, carrying placards, the announced closure of two local high schools.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of local The Greens representatives and other community members, around 150 people gathered outside the Grobenzell Leisure Centre in Munchen (Bayern) to protest against an AfD election campaign event, aiming to voice opposition to the AfD's presence and its political stance, highlighting the importance of defending democracy and expressing discontent with the party's policies.

On 23 May 2024, under the motto 'We for our fire brigade', more than 100 people gathered before the council meeting outside the town hall in Sinzig (Rheinland-Pfalz) to protest for a secure location for the new fire station. Their gathering coincided with the deliberations of the Sinzig City Council.

On 23 May 2024, PETA activists gathered in Stuttgart (Baden-Wurttemberg), displaying signs like 'Fishing is murder' and 'Close the fish market', aiming to raise awareness about animal rights issues associated with fishing.

On 23 May 2024, around 22 people gathered in Trebbin (Brandenburg), to protest against a 30 km/h speed-limit sign with the additional label 'nursing home' in the city center, feeling discriminated against by the labeling of their area.

On 23 May 2024, on the occasion of the 75th anniversary of the German Basic Law and at the call of a coalition of nearly 40 local associations, parties, and organizations, numerous people gathered in Wittmund (Niedersachsen) to protest in support of democracy and against right-wing extremism.

On 23 May 2024, people called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Alcira (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which they argued would promote linguistic segregation and prioritize the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, 500 people, called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Alcoy (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which they argued would promote linguistic segregation and prioritize the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, more than 4,000 people, including teachers, called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Alicante (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which prioritizes the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, more than 100 or 200 people held a demonstration at the Park Guell in Barcelona - Gracia (Cataluna) against the Louis Vuitton fashion show organized in the park. They argued that it was a protected monument, and denounced the fact that it would be closed to the public and that surrounding roads would be restricted to traffic. Police dispersed the demonstration with a dispersion charge and truncheon blows. Demonstrators clashed with the police leading to one arrest and seven police officers being injured.

On 23 May 2024, people, including teachers, called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Castello de la Plana (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which prioritizes the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, around 800 people, including teachers and students, called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Denia (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which prioritizes the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. Members of the local government (PSOE and Compromise Coalition) took part in the protest. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, thousands of people, including teachers and students, called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Elche (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which prioritizes the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, people called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Elda (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which they argued would promote linguistic segregation and prioritize the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, people called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Gandia (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which they argued would promote linguistic segregation and prioritize the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, on the occasion of the real state Asprima-SIMA awards, around 100 people held a protest in Madrid - Retiro (Madrid) to demand affordable housing solutions without vulture funds. Members of Madrid Tenants Union (Sindicato de Inquilinas de Madrid), the Madrid Housing Coordinator / PAH (Coordinadora de Vivienda de Madrid / PAH), the Carabanchel Housing Union (Sindicato de Vivienda de Carabanchel), Extinction Rebellion, and Ecologists in Action took part in the protest.

On 23 May 2024, people called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Onteniente (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which they argued would promote linguistic segregation and prioritize the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, students protested on the university campus of the Balearic School of Dramatic Arts (Esadib) in Palma de Mallorca (Islas Baleares) in support of Palestine and Gaza. Protesters demanded a permanent ceasefire and the end of the 'genocide'.

On 23 May 2024, people called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Petrer (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which they argued would promote linguistic segregation and prioritize the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, people called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Sagunto (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which they argued would promote linguistic segregation and prioritize the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, around 300 teachers, called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held a protest in Torrevieja (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which prioritizes the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, 4,300 people in total, including teachers and students, called by Platform in Defense of Public Education (Plataforma en Defensa de l'Ensenyament Public) held two protests in Valencia (Valencia) against the new law of educational freedom championed by PP and Vox, which prioritizes the Spanish language at the expense of the Valencian language. The protest was followed by a strike.

On 23 May 2024, residents, called by Green Vigo/Barroca Platform (plataforma Vigo Verde /Barroca), held a protest in Vigo (Galicia) against plans by the City Council to build a multipurpose center in the last alluvial forest in the area, citing concerns about the felling of trees and the harm done to the forests' fauna and flora.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGT, SUD, and SNJ, journalists gathered in Amiens (Hauts-de-France) to protest against the planned merger of all public broadcasters, which they deemed potentially damaging to their independence and job security.

On 23 May 2024, teachers gathered outside the Mario Beulaygue school in Ax-les-Thermes (Occitanie) to oppose the government's education reform, especially the introduction of level groups for students, and demand more state funding for public schools.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGT, SUD, and SNJ, journalists gathered in Caen (Normandie) to protest against the planned merger of all public broadcasters, which they deemed potentially damaging to their independence and job security.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of FO and SNSPP-PATS - National Union of Professional Firefighters-Administrative, technical and specialized staff (Syndicat National des Sapeurs-Pompiers Professionnels-Personnel Administratif, Technique et Specialise), striking firefighters gathered for a picket line in Carcassonne (Occitanie) to demand more staff and better working conditions.

On 23 May 2024, striking teachers gathered for a picket line outside the Georges-Sand school in Cregy-les-Meaux (Ile-de-France) to oppose the government's education reform, especially the introduction of level groups for students, and demand more state funding for public schools.

On 23 May 2024, around 80 people, including students and teachers, gathered outside the rectorate in Dijon (Bourgogne-Franche-Comte) to protest against the release of a philosophy teacher due to budget cuts at the Anna Judic school in Semur-en-Auxois.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of SNES-FSU, teachers gathered outside the local school in Ducey-les-Cheris (Normandie) to oppose the government's education reform, especially the introduction of level groups for students, and demand more state funding for public schools.

On 23 May 2024, around 50 people, including striking teachers, students' parents, students, and national deputy Arnaud Le Gall (LFI), gathered outside the Academic Inspection in Goussainville (Ile-de-France) to oppose the government's education reform, especially the introduction of level groups for students, and demand more state funding for public schools.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of SNJ, about 12 journalists gathered in Le Mans (Pays de la Loire) to protest against the planned merger of all public broadcasters, which they deemed potentially damaging to their independence and job security.

On 23 May 2024, teachers gathered outside the Petits-Sentiers school in Luce (Centre-Val de Loire) to oppose the government's education reform, especially the introduction of level groups for students, and demand more state funding for public schools.

On 23 May 2024, teachers and students' parents gathered outside the Paul-Verlaine school in Maizieres-les-Metz (Grand Est) to oppose the government's education reform, especially the introduction of level groups for students, and demand more state funding for public schools.

On 23 May 2024, around 30 taxi drivers gathered outside the Taxi Radio Marseille (TRM) headquarters in Marseille (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to protest against an agreement with Uber and demand the resignation of the director of TRM.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of the Student Committee for Palestine (Comite Etudiant pour la Palestine), several hundred students gathered inside an auditorium and blocked access to the Saint-Charles campus of the Aix-Marseille University in Marseille (Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur) to express solidarity with Palestinian people, condemn what they deemed an Israeli 'genocide' of Gazans, and demanded French universities to stop cooperating with Israeli universities. Police intervened to remove around 42 students on the same day.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGT, around 50 people gathered outside the Enedis headquarters in Merignac (Gironde) (Nouvelle-Aquitaine) to demand the dismissal of all disciplinary charges against two fellow employees who were responsible for power cuts during the demonstration wave against the pension reform. The protesters condemned what they deemed a repression of unions by management.

On 23 May 2024, around 100 people, including members of the New Caledonian community, demonstrated in Montpellier (Occitanie) to demand peace in New Caledonia after the beginning of riots involving pro-independence activists from the Kanak community, loyalists, and French law enforcement forces.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGT, SNJ, and FO, striking France 3 journalists and employees gathered for a picket line in Nantes (Pays de la Loire) to protest against the planned merger of all public broadcasters, which they deemed potentially damaging to their independence and job security.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of SUD and CGT, around 30 people, mostly health workers, gathered outside the Court of Justice in Orleans (Centre-Val de Loire) to express solidarity with two nurses who are facing charges for refusing to register with the National Office of Nurses (ONI).
On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGT, FO, UNSA, and CFTC, around 100 health workers gathered in Paris (Ile-de-France) to demand the payment of a 2,000-euro bonus during the Paris 2024 Summer Olympics.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGT, SUD, and SNJ, several hundred journalists, as well as national deputies Olivier Serva (R&PS) and Sophie Taille-Polian (LE), senator David Assouline (PS), and CGT Secretary General Sophie Binet, gathered in Paris (Ile-de-France) to protest against the planned merger of all public broadcasters, which they deemed potentially damaging to their independence and job security.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of SNES-FSU, teachers gathered outside the Turgot school in Paris (Ile-de-France) to protest against the suppression of a Senior Educational Adviser (CPE) at the Turgot school due to budget cuts and demand more state funding for public schools.

On 23 May 2024, around 15 striking France 3 journalists gathered for a picket line in Pau (Nouvelle-Aquitaine) to protest against the planned merger of all public broadcasters, which they deemed potentially damaging to their independence and job security.

On 23 May 2024, around 100 people, mostly students' parents and students, gathered outside the Fontaine-Blanche school in Plougastel (Bretagne) to oppose the government's education reform, especially the introduction of level groups for students, and demand more state funding for public schools.

On 23 May 2024, striking teachers and students' parents gathered for a picket line outside the Trochon school in Saint-Soupplets (Ile-de-France) to oppose the government's education reform, especially the introduction of level groups for students, and demand more state funding for public schools.
On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGT, striking elderly home (EHPAD) workers gathered for a picket line in Suresnes (Ile-de-France) to demand better working conditions and more respect from management.
On 23 May 2024, Stop Knauff Illange affiliates gathered outside the Court of Justice in Thionville (Grand Est) to demand compensation after gas leaks from the Knauff factory in Illange.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGT, SUD, and SNJ, about 15 journalists gathered in Toulouse (Occitanie) to protest against the planned merger of all public broadcasters, which they deemed potentially damaging to their independence and job security.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGT, around 50 students gathered outside the medical faculty in Tours (Pays de la Loire) to demand the exclusion of a student accused of sexual assault by several other students.
On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGT, around 20 municipal road workers gathered for a picket line in Villefranche-de-Lauragais (Occitanie) to protest against the release of two colleagues.

On 23 May 2024, members of Unison gathered outside Suffolk County Council's office in Ipswich (England) to protest against local government cuts, arguing they could put 350 jobs at risk across the county. Protesters held signs that read 'Stop the Cuts in Suffolk', while chanting slogans such as 'No ifs, no buts, no more cuts'.

On 23 May 2024, dozens of Deliveroo delivery riders gathered outside the offices of White & Case law firm in London - City of London (England) to protest poor working conditions and low pay. The protest happened during the firm's annual general meeting. Protesters held up placards saying: 'Justice for riders' and 'Riders suffer, bosses profit'.

actors: Police Forces of the United Kingdom (2010-)
notes: On 23 May 2024, pro-Palestine students at Oxford University held a sit-in protest in an administration office building in Wellington Square in Oxford (England) in support of Palestine. Police forces intervened and arrested 16 protesters.

actors: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Coast Guard
notes: Other: On 23 May 2024, Greece's coast guard picked up migrants from an islet off the Coast of Symi. They had set sail from Turkey. More migrants were collected from the same islet the following day, bringing the total to 22.

On 23 May 2024, doctors and nurses at the Thriasio hospital of Eleusis protested shouting slogans during a visit by the Minister of Health over understaffing and underfunding of the hospital and the National Health System in general. They also protested the precarious employment of their colleagues on short term contracts, who were indispensable in the running of the hospital, and plans to dismiss current staff to outsource cleaning services.

On 23 May 2024, a group of people from the PPP Youth Front, a sympathizer of the PPP party, protested in front of the PPP headquarters in Central Jakarta city (Jakarta province) (coded as Jakarta - Central). They criticized the current leadership of PPP. A group of people wearing PPP uniforms intervened, detained several protesters, and dispersed the protest. There were no casualties.

On 23 May 2024, 250 workers of PT Bumi Menara Internusa (BMI) seafood processing factory peacefully protested in front of the court building in Kepanjen district (Malang regency, East Java province). They opposed the court ruling regarding a land dispute involving PT BMI, which ordered the company to relocate its factory. They claimed it would negatively affect the workers' livelihood.

On 23 May 2024, a group of Papuan students from the Merauke Student Association peacefully protested in Ngguti Bob village (Tanah Miring district, Merauke regency, South Papua province). They opposed the conversion of 2 hectares of land into a sugarcane plantation. They claimed it would negatively affect local people's occupations and livelihoods and potentially damage the environment.

On 23 May 2024, a Naxal-Maoist 'commander', was killed in a clash with the joint team of West Singhbhum District, Khunti Police, and Commando Battalion for Resolute Action (CoBRA) 209 Battalion personnel in the Saranda Forest area between Baladih and Nawada villages located on the borders of Chaibasa, Seraikela, and Khunti under the Karaikela Police Station limits (West Singhbhum district, Jharkhand), during a search operation in the area. Security forces seized a .9mm pistol, 134 live bullets of the 7.65 Self-Loading Rifle (SLR) firearm, 20 live bullets of the .9mm pistol, and two magazines of the SLR, among other items, from the site.
On 23 May 2024, 1 unidentified Naxal-Maoist rebels was killed by the security forces (coded as police) in an encounter in Khunti district (Jharkhand).

actors: Police Forces of India (2014-) District Reserve Group
source: South Asia Terrorism Portal; Times of India
notes: On 23 May 2024, People's Liberation Guerrilla Army (PLGA) rebels, clashed with 1000 joint forces of Narayanpur and Bastar DRG, Bastar fighters, and STF in the Handawada-Rekhawaya dense forest (Narayanpur, Chhattisgarh), after CPI (Maoist) rebels fired at security forces whilst they were on a 71 hour long major joint operation 'Jal Shakti'. Seven unidentified PLGA rebels, including three women, were killed.

On 23 May 2024, suspected members of BJD set ablaze the house of a Dalit man in Sabhamula village within Jagatsinghpur police limits (Jagatsinghapur, Odisha), after he refused to support a BJD candidate ahead of the sixth phase of Lok Sabha and simultaneous state elections. The assailants set the house on fire at night when his wife, daughter and daughter-in-law were sleeping in the house. The daughter sustained injury in the attack.

On 23 May 2024, police personnel suspectedly tortured a person in police custody at the Jaitaran police station in Beawar town (Ajmer, Rajasthan) over a sexual assault-related complaint. The person later committed suicide at the police station. His family claims the police killed them in custody and are now framing it as a suicide.

On 23 May 2024, unidentified assailants attacked and killed a BRS functionary at his residence in Lakshmipalle village (Wanaparthy, Telangana) suspectedly over political reasons. Locals found the victim's body in the early hours of the morning.

Property destruction: On 23 May 2024, TMC supporters vandalised several houses of BJP supporters, and set some of them on fire, Mansabazar and Southkali areas in Nandigram area (coded as Nandigram city, Purba Medinipur district, WB) after political tensions escalated following the killing of a BJP woman leader ahead of the Lok Sabha elections (coded separately).

Property destruction: On 23 May 2024, BJP supporters vandalised more than 100 houses of TMC supporters, including at Mansabazar, Bheturia and Southkali areas in Nandigram area (coded as Bhetugram city (Purba Medinipur district, WB)) in suspected retaliation to the killing of a BJP woman leader ahead of the Lok Sabha elections (coded separately).

On 23 May 2024, one group fired at another group during a clash at Jogian area in Bishnah tehsil (Jammu district, J&K) over a land dispute. One person was left injured in the clash. Police later arrested one person.

On 23 May 2024, members of BJD and BJP clashed with stones and glass bottles at Tardinga village under Athagarh Assembly constituency (Cuttack, Odisha) when BJP members were campaigning for the party candidate by distributing money and liquor. Two BJD supporters, including a minor, were injured. Police arrested three BJP members after the incident.
On 23 May 2024, BJP members pushed barricades and clashed with police during a political rally at Kolkata city (WB) when they attempted to them from conducting the rally.

On 23 May 2024, a group of five cow vigilantes assaulted and killed a Muslim man (based on the name) in Banaskantha district (coded to Palanpur, Gujarat) when he was transporting buffaloes to a cattle fair. Police later arrested 2 accused persons involved in the killing.
Other: On 23 May 2024, administration demolished the 'illegally' constructed house of the accused linked to the rape and murder of a 6-year-old girl in Burhanpur city (Madhya Pradesh).

On 23 May 2024, members of the BJP Other Backward Class (OBC) Morcha (unit), led by the BJP OBC state president, staged a protest and burned an effigy outside Banga Bhawan (building) in Delhi - New Delhi city (Delhi) against the West Bengal Chief Minister and the INDIA (an alliance of parties in opposition to BJP's NDA) whom the protesters accused of policies that are anti-Dalits, OBCs, and tribals.

On 23 May 2024, about 30-35 councilors, mostly from the BJP, and cutting across party lines, staged a protest 'Day 2' at the District headquarters in Ghaziabad city (Uttar Pradesh) demanding the withdrawal of the strict action taken against a BJP councilor who was accused of assaulting a vendor and his wife on 19 May (coded separately).On 22 May 2024, councilors, cutting across party lines, staged a protest at the District headquarters in Ghaziabad city (Uttar Pradesh) demanding the withdrawal of the strict action taken against a BJP councilor who was accused of assaulting a vendor and his wife on 19 May (coded separately). The protesters scuffled (likely non-violent) with the police when they attempted to march towards the police commissioner's residence.

On 23 May 2024, members of the BJP including an MP and OBC Morcha President staged a protest at the Jyothiba Phule statue in the Amberpet locality in Hyderabad city (Telangana) against the proposal to implement reservations for Muslims under the Backward Classes (BC) quota. The protesters asked the BC community members to support the BJP in order to ensure that their rights were safeguarded.

On 23 May 2024, members of the BRS staged a rasta roko (road block) protest with the body of a BRS functionary who was killed by unidentified assailants (coded separately) in Chinnambavi village (Wanaparthy, Telangana) demanding the INC-led state government to take measures to stop political violence in the state. The protesters also demanded capital punishment for the accused and raised slogans against an INC minister to mark their protest.

On 23 May 2024, farmers under the banner of Pagdi Sambhal Jatta Kisan Sangharsh Samiti (a farmer group) staged a '3-day' sit-in protest outside the police station and burnt effigies in Jakhal town (Fatehabad, Haryana) against a BJP nominee (former MP) for the Lok Sabha elections and a BJP MP whom the protesters accused of driving recklessly during a demonstration near Sant Nagar village on 12 May (coded separately). The protesters accused the police of taking action on the complaint (against the farmers) registered by the BJP nominee, while no action was taken on their complaint.

On 23 May 2024, members of BKU (Ugrahan) staged a protest rally in Patiala city (Punjab) during the campaign rally of the Prime Minister of India (BJP) for the Lok Sabha elections. Farmers in the state have been staging protests condemning the BJP-led central government for the excessive intervention during the farmer's 'Delhi Chalo' protests and for failing to address their long-standing demands. The protesters were allotted a designated spot in the city to stage their protest.

On 23 May 2024, locals led by a former panch (village government head) held a protest by blocking a highway at Koreponu area in Hiranagar tehsil (Kathua district, WB) over a road accident involving a dumper in which two persons were killed and demanded that dumpers no longer be allowed.

On 23 May 2024, villagers, members of the Loutolim Tenants Association, a former Sarpanch (village head) and social activist and a Deputy Sarpanch (village head) staged a protest in Loutolim village (South Goa, Goa) against the proposed Borim Bridge and bypass project. The protesters said that they will not give away their ancestral land for any government project.

On 23 May 2024, city INC leaders held a protest at the office of Divisional Commissioner and Lokayukta in Indore city (Madhya Pradesh) demanding a CBI probe into the 'fake bill scam' of Indore Municipal Corporation (IMC).

On 23 May 2024, UDF and INC councillors staged a protest in Kochi city (Ernakulam, Kerala) against the Kochi Corporation for not cleaning the drains in the city before the onset of the monsoon season. The protesters removed weeds from the Karanakkodam drain to mark their protest.

On 23 May 2024, members of the KRV staged a protest at the tahsildar's office in Hubballi city (Dharwad, Karnataka) demanding the transfer of the police commissioner for failing to maintain the law and order in the city and for not stopping the increasing cases of crimes against women. The protesters raised slogans to mark their protest.

On 23 May 2024, residents and hotel owners held a protest at Gagangeer-Choonadagi area (coded as Gangangir town (Ganderbal district, J&K)) against the power cuts imposed by the local power department and demanded 24 hour supply for running their business.

On 23 May 2024, members of NSUI led by the district president burned the effigy of Madhya Pradesh CBI and held a protest at Tower Chowk in Ujjain city (Madhya Pradesh) over its investigation into the nursing college scam.

On 23 May 2024, two groups of parishioners of the CSI congregation staged protests and counter protests in front of the Mateer Memorial CSI Church at the LMS Junction in Thiruvananthapuram city (Kerala) over who would be in charge of the church administration. The two groups supported two different bishops and shouted slogans against each other.

On 23 May 2024, farmers under the banners of SKM, KMM, and SKM (Non-political), including those who have been protesting at the Punjab-Haryana border area (ongoing), staged a dharna (sit-in protest) along the Rajpura Road at the Toll plaza next to Dharehi Jattan village (Patiala, Punjab) when they stopped from marching towards Patiala city where the Prime Minister of India (BJP) was conducting a campaign rally for the Lok Sabha elections. Farmers in the state have been staging protests condemning the BJP-led central government for the excessive intervention during the farmer's 'Delhi Chalo' protests and for failing to address their long-standing demands.

On 23 May 2024, farmers under the banners of SKM, KMM, and SKM (Non-political), including those who have been protesting at the Punjab-Haryana border area (ongoing), staged multiple dharnas (sit-in protest) along the Pehowa, Samana, Sangrur, Sirhind and Nabha Roads in the Patiala district (Punjab) when they stopped from marching towards Patiala city where the Prime Minister of India (BJP) was conducting a campaign rally for the Lok Sabha elections. Farmers in the state have been staging protests condemning the BJP-led central government for the excessive intervention during the farmer's 'Delhi Chalo' protests and for failing to address their long-standing demands.

On 23 May 2024, members of the TPDK staged a protest in Coimbatore city (Tamil Nadu) against a comment made by the Prime Minister in relation to the treasure room keys of the Puri Jagannath Temple while he was campaigning for the Lok Sabha elections in Odisha. The protesters demanded that the Prime Minister to apologise for his words.

On 23 May 2024, local women staged a protest and placed carts along the Shani Bazaar (market) Road in Haldwani city (Nainital, Uttarakhand) against the prolonged lack of supply of drinking water in the area.

On 23 May 2024, around 170 girls residing at the Ambedkar Post Matric Hostel along with members of the SFI staged a protest outside the residence of the Assistant Commissioner of Lingsugur Revenue Division in Lingsugur town (Raichur, Karnataka) accusing the hostel authorities of not providing basic amenities and good quality food despite repeated requests.

On 23 May 2024, family members of a deceased father-son duo and villagers held a protest at the SP office in Neemuch city (Madhya Pradesh), claiming inaction and negligence by the police in Manasa after the death of the duo due to electrocution on May 13.

On 23 May 2024, locals held a protest at Nandigram city (Purba Medinipur district, WB) against TMC over the death of a BJP woman in an attack in the same area (coded separately) during the Lok Sabha elections.
On 23 May 2024, scores of family members of railway employees held a protest by blocking a railway line at Jammu city (J&K) over lack of water supply in the railway colony.

On 23 May 2024, local people staged a protest and placed stones along the Lalganj-Kalwari Road in Kolkam Kalan area (Mirzapur, Uttar Pradesh) against the death of a motorcycle-borne man and his who were hit and killed by a truck. The man's daughter also suffered serious injuries.

On 23 May 2024, farmers affiliated to the Tamil Nadu Vivasaygal Sangam (Tamil Nadu Farmers Association) along with members of the CPI(M) staged a protest outside the Sub-Collector's office in Hosur city (Krishnagiri, Tamil Nadu) against the laying of a gas pipeline by the Gas Authority Of India Ltd (GAIL) for a gas pipeline project. The protesters demanded the officials to stop the protest and were arrested by the police.

On 23 May 2024, INC councillors took out a protest march from the Thekke Gopura Nada to the Mayor's chamber at the Thrissur Corporation in Thrissur city (Kerala) against the delay in cleaning the drainage canals in the city which had led to heavy flooding in the heavy rains. The protesters carried the water hyacinths that were collected from the water canals to mark their protest and threw the weeds on the corporation campus. The police arrested the protesters.

source: Indo-Asian News Service; Live Mint; Times of India
notes: On 23 May 2024, locals and BJP members held a massive demonstration, forced shop to close, vandalised shops belonging to TMC members and burnt tyres at Nandigram city (Purba Medinipur district, WB) over the killing of a BJP woman member in an attack during the Lok Sabha elections in the same area (coded separately). Police, RAF and central forces (likely CRPF given they form the bulk of central forces) engaged in baton charge to control the situation and detained one person.

On 23 May 2024, farmers staged a demonstration along the road in Pasiana village (Patiala, Punjab) against a BJP nominee (MP) for the Lok Sabha elections and clashed with the police. Both the BJP nominee and the demonstrators were on their way towards Patiala city where the Prime Minister of India (BJP) was conducting a campaign rally for the Lok Sabha elections. Farmers in the state have been staging demonstrations condemning the BJP-led central government for the excessive intervention during the farmer's 'Delhi Chalo' demonstrations and for failing to address their long-standing demands. The police intervened and used mild force to disperse the demonstrators which resulted in minor injuries to a few policemen and a demonstrator.

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), a group of people staged a demonstration at the Burail police outpost in Chandigarh city for unidentified reasons. The demonstrations were also accused of manhandling (likely violent) the police outpost in charge when he tried to intervene. A video of the incident was circulated online.

source: Chronicle News Service (India); E-Pao; Sangai Express
notes: On 23 May 2024, a large number of Meira Paibi (Women Torch Bearers) of Lamphel Khunou tore a signboard, removed barricades placed by Regional Institute of Medical Sciences (RIMS) on the northern entrance to the mortuary and physically assaulted an unarmed civil security in Imphal city (Imphal West, Manipur) claiming that RIMS defied a court order allowing public usage of the road and blocked it. RIMS denied claims.

Other: On 23 May 2024, Hynniewtrep Youth Council members (comprising Khasi and Jaintia tribal groups) dismantled around 80 houses belonging to 'illegal settlers' at Lum Survey in Shillong city (East Khasi Hills, Meghalaya) as a part of an eviction drive citing drug menace as one of the reasons. The HYC had previously given the district administration a deadline to evict the 'illegal settlers' and issued a notice to them to leave the area. A case was filed against HYC members for carrying out an illegal eviction drive.

Other: Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), Medhipara society banned 14 families from participating in any social activities in Mangaldai town (Darrang, Assam) for attending an event of the Sankari sect. The social activities included local festivals such as Holi and Bihu (Assamese festival).

On 23 May 2024, hundreds of tea garden labourers staged a protest in front of Powai Tea Estate garden office near Powai village (Tinsukia, Assam) demanding regular power supply at their quarters, better healthcare facilities and termination of a staff appointed from outside the tea garden.

On 23 May 2024, locals staged a road block protest for 2 hours and blocked the main road going through Mangalkhali village within Jubarajnagar village (North Tripura, Tripura) condemning the poor road constructions and demanded immediate repairs. The blockade was lifted after a representative of a road contractor gave assurances to protesters.

On 23 May 2024, around 300 people staged a demonstration at the police outpost in Khelmati village (Sonitpur, Assam) after an arrested man died in police custody and condemned police forces for torturing him despite his innocence. The demonstration turned violent as police and CRPF personnel used lathi charges and tear gas, while demonstrators pelted stones. One police officer and two journalists were injured, a police vehicle was damaged, and one demonstrator was arrested.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGIL, around 1,500 people, including workers, took to the streets from XX Settembre Square to Nettuno Square in Bologna (Emilia-Romagna) to protest against the worsening of working conditions and the quality of public services.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGIL and UIL, workers gathered in front of the Enel power plant in Cerano (Piemonte) to protest against the uncertainty about the future of the facility, in view of the decommissioning of the power plant. Later, protesters set off towards the state road 613 where they blocked traffic. The police blocked access to the highway.

On 23 May 2024, people, including pro-Palestinian students and researchers, staged a protest at the European University Institute in Fiesole (Toscana) to ask for a ceasefire in Gaza and for the interruption of the conference 'The State of Union', in which the Italian Minister of Foreign Affairs and the EU's High Representative for External Affairs were taking place, in favor of a meeting organized by the researchers and the staff of the institute.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of FdI, people took to the streets in the Barriera di Milano neighborhood of Torino (Piemonte) to protest against the openings of ethnic minimarkets which, according to protesters, are out of control. Protesters held a banner with the words 'stop the degradation of minimarkets'.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGIL and other unspecified trade unions, workers of the Fabbri Group staged a protest in front of the factory in Per Sassuolo Street in Vignola (Emilia-Romagna) against their contract and to ask for an increase in their old performance bonuses.

On 23 May 2024, about 100 doctors and dentists protested in front of the 1st Congressional Chamber of the House of Representatives in Tokyo - Chiyoda against the government policy to abolish the current health insurance card and integrate it with the My Number Card. They called for the continuation of the current health insurance card. 4 Diet members from CDP, JCP, and SDPJ attended the event. Hodanren organized the event.

On 23 May 2024, people, including an independent member of the Musashino City Assembly, protested in Mitaka, Tokyo, to call for the freedom of Palestine and a ceasefire in the armed conflict between Hamas and Israel. They also opposed the Israeli attack on Gaza, the military expansion, and the construction of a U.S. military base in Henoko.

source: Anti-War Committee Of 1000; Kyodo News; Tokyo Shimbun; Twitter
notes: On 23 May 2024, about 300 people, including the NAJAT representative and members from the Peace Forum and Women's Democratic Club, protested in front of the US Embassy in Tokyo - Minato to call for the freedom of Palestine. They urged the Biden administration not to export weapons to Israel and criticized its veto in the UN ceasefire resolution. The protesters also opposed the Israeli attack on Gaza. The Peace in Palestine! Emergency Action organized the event. A rapper with roots in Palestine and Japan and members from the Association of National Defense Academy Graduates against Genocide and Japanese Coalition Against Military Research in Academia attended the event.

On 23 May 2024, people protested at Shinjuku station in Tokyo - Shinjuku to call to raise women's rights to international standards. They called for gender equality. The 'Action to Realize the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women' and 'Group to Achieve Ratification of the Optional Protocol by the Time of the Review of Japan's Report by the Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women' organized the event. Members of the m-net Civil Code Reform Information Network and 'Japan NGO Network for the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women' and Diet members from JCP, CDP, and SDPJ attended the event.
On 23 May 2024, people gathered at Hibiya Open-Air Concert Hall in Tokyo - Chiyoda, to call for the retrial of Sayama case.
On 23 May 2024, people marched in Onojo, Fukuoka, to call for a 'Complete school lunch for all system' in which all students eat the same school lunch as in elementary schools.

On 23 May 2024, protesters, including local environmental and civic group members, held a press conference with a banner and picketed in front of the Busan Metropolitan City Hall (Busan - Yeonje). They urged the authorities to abolish the bill to establish a permanent repository for high-level radioactive waste management.

On 23 May 2024, members of the FKTU-affiliated Gyeonggi Teachers Union held a press conference with a banner and picketed in front of the Gyeonggi Provincial Office of Education (Suwon). They urged the authorities to come up with specific measures that can guarantee students' safety during the field trip.

On 23 May 2024, members of the KCTU-affiliated Korean Teachers and Education Workers Union (KTU) held a press conference with a banner and picketed in front of the Uijeonbu Police Station (Uijeongbu). They urged the authorities to reinvestigate the death of a local elementary teacher who allegedly died due to malicious complaints from school parents.

On 23 May 2024, protesters, including students of the Jeju National University medical school, held a protest and picketed at the university (Jeju). They opposed the government's decision to increase the medical school enrollment quota and protested against the university's reflection of the decision.

On 23 May 2024, members of the KCTU-affiliated Korean Metal Workers' Union (KMWU) Pohang branch held a press conference with a banner in front of the Daegu District Court Pohang Division (Pohang). They urged the POSCO to comply with the court's decision not to discriminate against employees affiliated with their subcontractors and stop the labor oppression.

On 23 May 2024, about 200 Donghae-myeon residents staged a protest in front of the Pohang City Hall (Pohang) and opposed the installation of a memorial park and crematorium in the village due to concerns over the local economy and air pollution.

On 23 May 2024, protesters, including members of the KCTU Jeonbuk branch, Jeonbuk Minjung Action, and Gunsan Civic Society, held a press conference with a banner and picketed in front of the Jeonju District Public Prosecutor's Office Gunsan Branch (Gunsan). They urged the authorities to imprison the owner of SeAH Besteel for continued industrial accidents.

On 23 May 2024, members of the KCTU-affiliated Korean Public Service and Transport Workers' Union (KPTU) held a press conference with a banner in front of the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, and Transport (Sejong City - Dodam). They urged the authorities to announce the specific date to initiate the implementation of a complete monthly wage system for taxi drivers.

On 23 May 2024, protesters, including the members of the Flaming Feminist Action and Activists Group for Human Rights Baram, staged a protest in front of the Embassy of Israel (Seoul City - Jongno). They condemned Israel's attack against Palestinian civilians. They demanded that Israel stop the massacre.

On 23 May 2024, members of the Seoul Metro Allbaleun Employee Union held a press conference with a banner and picketed in front of the Seoul Metropolitan Government (Seoul City - Jung). They condemned the Seoul Metro executives who were absent from work without due notice.

On 23 May 2024, protesters, including members of the Korea Council of Centers for Independent Living and disabled persons, held a press conference and picketed in front of the National Human Rights Commission of Korea (Seoul City - Jung). They urged the authorities to revise their policies to allow the elderly with severe disabilities to join public employment programs for severely disabled persons.

On 23 May 2024, protesters held a press conference with a banner and picketed in front of the Supreme Court of South Korea (Seoul City - Seocho). They demanded the court's swift conviction of the Japanese company's forceful sale of assets in South Korea in order to compensate Korean forced labor victims during Japan's colonial rule.

On 23 May 2024, about 20,000 protesters, including members of the Korean Nurses Association, held a rally in front of the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo). They urged the authorities to enact the Nursing Act within the terms of the 21st National Assembly and promote the rights of nurses.

On 23 May 2024, protesters, including lawmakers affiliated with the Justice Party and DPK and civic group members, held a press conference with a banner at the National Assembly (Seoul City - Yeongdeungpo). They demanded that Israel stop the massacre and attack against Palestinian civilians.

On 23 May 2024, Mokpo-si mayor, Mokpo-si Council president, and Mokpo National University president held a press conference with a banner at Mokpo City Hall (Mokpo). They urged the authorities to establish a medical school and affiliated hospital at the Mokpo National University.

On 23 May 2024, members of the KCTU-affiliated School Irregular Worker's Union Ulsan branch held a press conference with a banner and picketed at the Ulsan Metropolitan Office of Education (Ulsan - Jung). They urged local education authorities to improve school cafeterias' working conditions and increase the workforce of school meal workers.

On 23 May 2024, about half a dozen people protested in front of the Vilnius City Municipality in Vilnius, Lithuania, calling against the announced plans to close Vincos Mykolaitis-Putins's, Vincos Kreves-Mickevicius' and Venclovu's memorial museums.

On 23 May 2024, an unknown number of employees of the cleaning company Wisag Cleaning Services joined a picket strike organized by trade unions OGBL and LCGB in front of the headquarters of the company in Senningerberg (Luxembourg) to denounce unpaid and late wages. The payroll complications were due to a computer glitch during the group's software changeover but the protesters demanded immediate action to resolve the problem.
On 23 May 2024, at the call of USM, striking hotel workers gathered for a picket line outside the Louis II stadium in Monaco (Monaco) to demand a pay rise.

On 23 May 2024, residents of Prilep and citizens from all over Macedonia blocked the road to the village of Oreovec and are not allowing machines and workers to continue blasting and digging the area. They claim the planned road reconstruction will pollute their environment, affect their water supply and eliminate green spaces in the area.

Displacement: On 23 May 2024, in Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), over 10,000 villagers from Ma Yoe Kone, Za Lat Kone, Kan Kaw, Gin Ge, Ywar Shey, Nyaung To, Thit Yon, Kaing, Yan Ta Po, U Da Ya, Sin Chaung, Taw Pu and Si Mee Khon villages were forced to flee their homes due to the military raids.

Displacement: Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), in Thandwe town (Thandwe township, Thandwe district, Rakhine state), more than 1,000 locals were forced to flee as the armed clashes between the Myanmar military and the Arakan Army intensified and approach to the town.

On 23 May 2024, in Shwebo town (Shwebo township, Shwebo district, Sagaing region), a combined force of the Freedom Revolution Force, Taze People Comrades (Shwebo District PDF (B-25)) and the People's Defense Force - Shwebo District (B-24) attacked the No.8 military training base with four 107 mm rockets, hitting the weapon storage room in the training base. In response to the attack, the military fired back 60 mm artillery rounds. 2 military soldiers were killed.

source: Independent Mon News Agency; Karen Information Center News
notes: On 23 May 2024, in Zoke Thoke Ywar Gyi village (Bilin township, Thaton district, Mon state), two members of the Kyaikhto Revolution Force shot dead a USDP member, who was also a military informant, while he was riding a motorcycle on the main road between the Zoke Thoke Sin Min pagoda and a hospital in the morning. The Kyaikhto Revolution Force also seized two grenades, 1,500 MMks and a bag from the USDP member.

On 23 May 2024, in Bhamo town (Bhamo township, Bhamo district, Kachin state), about 50 military soldiers opened fire in the air and arrested at least 10 locals from the Kan Thar Oo harbor area, accusing them of supporting the PDFs, at around 11 am. The military also seized rice bags, instant noodles, and rations from the area.

On 23 May 2024, in Kale town (Kale township, Kale district, Sagaing region), the military arrested a mother and a daughter from a restaurant near the Kale Air Force Base in Aung Thit Sar ward at around 2 am, accusing them of supporting the PDFs.

Property destruction: On 23 May 2024, in Mingaladon township (Yangon-North district, Yangon region), the military and gangsters destroyed about 200 houses in Pale (3) Ward after failing to draft locals for military conscription.

On 23 May 2024, in Myay Nu village (Singu township, Pyinoolwin district, Mandalay region), the military fired some artillery rounds at around 4 pm, hitting and killing a 78-year-old woman. Myanmar Pressphoto Agency reported that another 72-year-old man was also injured by 120 mm artillery rounds fired by the military between 19 to 23 May.

actors: CNF/CNA: Chin National Front/Chin National Army
source: Khit Thit Media; Khonumthung News; Myanmar Now; Radio Free Asia
notes: On 23 May 2024, in Tonzang town (Tonzang township, Falam district, Chin state), a combined force of the Chin National Army (CNF/CNA), Chinland Defense Force, Chinland Defense Force - Hualngoram, Yaw PDF and allies continued to attack the Myanmar military soldiers from IB-269 base, police and Zomi Revolutionary Army and claimed to have taken full control of the town as all military soldiers left the town. 40 military soldiers were captured and over 50 weapons were seized by the combined force during the 9 day fight. DVB and Myanmar Now reported that there were 11 fatalities on the military side within 7 days fight (15 - 21 May). Myanmar Now also reported that there were 2 fatalities and 10 injuries on the combined force side. Khit Thit Media reported on 24 May that there were 20 fatalities on the military side within 9 days fight (15 - 23 May). A total of 22 fatalities (20 military soldiers and 2 combined force members) split across 9 days (15 - 23 May), coded as 2 for the most up-to-date estimates.
On 23 May 2024, in Gin Ge village (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the military stationed at Na Bu Aing village fired artillery rounds on Gin Ge village. Casualties unknown.

On 23 May 2024, in Nyaung To village (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the military stationed at Na Bu Aing village fired artillery rounds on Nyaung To village. Casualties unknown.

On 23 May 2024, in Thit Yon village (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the military stationed at Na Bu Aing village fired artillery rounds on Thit Yon village. Casualties unknown.

On 23 May 2024, in Ywar Shey village (Myingyan township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the military stationed at Na Bu Aing village fired artillery rounds on Ywar Shey village. Casualties unknown.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Khit Thit Media; Mizzima; Myanmar Pressphoto Agency
notes: On 23 May 2024, between Khet Lan and Tat Si villages (coded as Khet Lan) (Natogyi township, Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the Natogyi PDF (Myingyan District PDF (B-4)) attacked a military checkpoint stationed by about 30 military soldiers with three drone bombs at around 9 am. 3 military soldiers, including a captain from the Meiktila airbase, were killed and six other military soldiers were injured.

source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Eleven Media Group; Independent Mon News Agency; Karen Information Center News; Khit Thit Media; Mizzima; Myanmar Now; Myanmar Pressphoto Agency; Radio Free Asia; Shwe Phee Myay News Agency; VOA
notes: On 23 May 2024, near Taung Ka Lay village (Bilin township, Thaton district, Mon state), an unknown armed group destroyed the Ma Saw bridge on the Yangon-Mawlamyine road around 5 am with a remote explosive. Three motorcycles fell from the bridge during the explosion and a man was killed. Two women and a man were injured and sent to a hospital.

On 23 May 2024, in Kawkareik township (Kawkareik district, Kayin state), a combined force of the White Dragon Battalion (South Division), Albino Tiger Column, Multirotor, Robinhood Rocket, and the Alpha Bats (Fixed Wing) Drone Force attacked the Aung Zay Ya military column near the Agriculture Zone area on Daw Na Hill, and both sides exchanged fire. During the fight, the combined force fired six rockets, hitting and destroying a military vehicle. In response, the military fired artillery rounds and set fire to some houses on the north side of the township. There were four injuries on the military side.

On 23 May 2024, ethnic Serbs and civil society representatives, including far-right supporters, protested in front of the government building in Podgorica, voicing their dissatisfaction with the government's decision to vote in favor of the Srebrenica genocide resolution within the United Nations. The protesters glorified the convicted war criminal, Ratko Mladic. The resolution intends to commemorate the genocide, without labeling one nation as culpable. The discourse from the political elite in Serbia and the Republika Srpska entity of Bosnia and Herzegovina is that this resolution labels the Serbian people as 'genocidal'.

On 23 May 2024, the Malaysian immigration department and the police arrested 124 foreign workers at a courier hub in Batu Pahat town (Batu Pahat district, Johor state). They did not have valid staying and working permits. Two locals, who were the manager and the HRD officer, were also arrested. The police also did another raid in Kulai on the same day (coded separately). They arrested foreigners from Myanmar, Pakistan, India, Indonesia, Bangladesh, Nepal, China, and Sudan in both raids.

On 23 May 2024, the Malaysian immigration department and the police arrested 106 foreign workers at a plastic component factory in Senai town (Kulai district, Johor state). They did not have valid staying and working permits. The police also conducted another raid in Batu Pahat on the same day (coded separately). They arrested foreigners from Myanmar, Pakistan, India, Indonesia, Bangladesh, Nepal, China, and Sudan in both raids.

On 23 May 2024, around 30 people from the Palestine Solidarity Secretariat (SSP), including a Machang MP, peacefully protested in front of the Ministry of Transport building in Putrajaya city (Federation of Putrajaya). They opposed the sale of the Malaysia Airports Holdings Bhd (MAHB) to Global Infrastructure Partners (GIP). They claimed GIP is owned by the BlackRock investment firm, which was suspected of being affiliated with Israel. They voiced support for Palestine.

On 23 May 2024, around 50 rival youth groups clashed violently and attacked cars with metal bars in Tsoundzou I (Mamoudzou). There was no report of injuries or fatalities. Police officers intervened to stop the fighting and disperse both groups.

Other: On 23 May 2024, French President Emmanuel Macron started his visit to Noumea (South) to call for an end to the riots on the island since 13 May. He met with pro-independence representatives (UC, Palika, CCAT) and announced that the French government would not impose the electoral body reform by force but rather negotiate an agreement with pro-independence parties. He announced a referendum on the reform once approved by all New Caledonian parties.

actors: Military Forces of New Caledonia (2021-) Gendarmes
notes: On 23 May 2024, rioters set up road blockades and clashed with gendarmerie and police forces in several locations in Noumea (New Caledonia). Security forces continued to dismantle road blockades around the island, notably in Nouville, Montravel, Tuband, and Portes-de-Fer. The rioters demonstrated against the constitutional bill project to enlarge the citizen electoral body, opening it up to people who have lived in New Caledonia for at least 10 years. Participants argued the move would go against the interests of the pro-independence movement.

On 23 May 2024, members and leaders of various student organizations, including SBU, ANNFSU, NSU, and ANNISU-R, staged a sit-in protest at Maitighar Mandala in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters were demanding improvements in the Early Childhood Development (ECD) education.

On 23 May 2024, various Dalit rights organizations, including DLF, staged a protest at Maitighar Mandala in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district). The protesters denounced caste-based discrimination and commemorated the passing of a Dalit youth involved in an inter-caste relationship in Rukum district a few years ago.

On 23 May 2024, civil society members, including journalists, protested by burning an effigy of the Deputy Prime Minister, who is also the Home Minister, in Nepalgunj city (Banke district). The protest was in response to the arrest of the chairman of Kantipur Media Group, which the protesters condemned as an infringement on the freedom of press.

Around 23 May 2024 (as reported), businesspersons protested by picketing the customs office in Janakpur city (Dhanusha district), claiming that the police had seized their goods that had already cleared customs.

On 23 May 2024, NTD protested by staging a torch rally in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district), demanding the resignation of the Deputy Prime Minister, who is also the Home Minister, over his involvement in a co-operative fraud case. The protesters were also against the arrest of the chairman of Kantipur Media Group.
On 23 May 2024, students led by Wildlife Conservation and Research Endeavor (Wild Care) Nepal staged a protest rally in Hetauda city (Makwanpur district), demanding the conservation of turtles.

Around 23 May 2024, locals protested by smearing black soot on two members of a local family in Belbari municipality-11 (Morang district) after a dispute regarding the construction of a road through the family's land.

On 23 May 2024, a clash ensued between members of the NSU and the police in Pokhara city (Kaski district). The incident occurred after the demonstrators demonstrated by burning an effigy of the Home Minister, accusing the latter of being involved in the cooperative fraud scandal.

On 23 May 2024, students gathered to protest at the University of Canterbury in Christchurch (Canterbury). They expressed support for Palestine and demanded that the administration divest from Israel.

On 23 May 2024, students gathered to protest at the University of Auckland in Auckland - Central (Auckland). They expressed support for Palestine and demanded that the administration divest from Israel.
On 23 May 2024, students gathered to protest at the University of Waikato in Hamilton (Waikato). They expressed support for Palestine and demanded that the administration divest from Israel.
On 23 May 2024, students gathered to protest at Victoria University in Wellington (Wellington). They expressed support for Palestine and demanded that the administration divest from Israel.
On 23 May 2024, students gathered to protest at the University of Otago in Dunedin (Otago). They expressed support for Palestine and demanded that the administration divest from Israel.

On 23 May 2024, students gathered to protest at Massey University in Palmerston North (Manawatu-Whanganui). They expressed support for Palestine and demanded that the administration divest from Israel.

On 23 May 2024, people, including members of Forest and Bird gathered to protest at a minerals sector strategy announcement in Blackball (West Coast). They demanded that the government divest from fossil fuels and prioritize green energy solutions.

On 23 May 2024, BLA militants opened fire at military personnel gathered around a vehicle near a camp in Rudkan locality of Kolwa area (Kech, Balochistan). BLA claim 2 military personnel were killed and 2 others were injured.

On 23 May 2024, unidentified armed men shot and injured a PML-N leader and his cousin at his outhouse in Chowk Sarwar Shaheed tehsil (Muzaffargarh, Sindh). No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

actors: Police Forces of Pakistan (2022-) Bomb Disposal Squad
source: Dawn (Pakistan); Khorasan Diary; South Asia Terrorism Portal
notes: Defusal: On 23 May 2024, bomb disposal squad recovered and defused a bomb planted by militants (coded as TTP) near the gate of a government primary school in Siddiqueabad Phatak locality of Nawagai area (Bajaur, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).
On 23 May 2024, farmers held a protest demonstration in Pithoro town (Umerkot, Sindh), against the shortage of water for their agricultural lands.

On 23 May 2024, journalists and members of the National Press Club held a protest demonstration in Johi town (Dadu, Sindh), demanding justice after a journalist was shot and killed in Mirpur Mathelo (coded separately).
On 23 May 2024, journalists held a protest demonstration in Ghotki city (Ghotki, Sindh), demanding justice after a journalist was shot and killed in Mirpur Mathelo (coded separately).
On 23 May 2024, journalists held a protest demonstration in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh), demanding justice after a journalist was shot and killed in Mirpur Mathelo town (coded separately).

On 23 May 2024, journalists held a protest demonstration at the press club in Sehwan town (Jamshoro, Sindh), demanding justice after a journalist was shot and killed in Mirpur Mathelo (coded separately).

On 23 May 2024, journalists held a protest demonstration in Thatta city (Thatta, Sindh), demanding justice after a journalist was shot and killed in Mirpur Mathelo (coded separately).
On 23 May 2024, truck drivers held a protest in Sargodha city (Sargodha, Punjab), against the police for 'torturing' a truck driver and his brother for not paying a bribe.
On 23 May 2024, employees of the Sehwam Development Authority (HDA) staged a protest demonstration in Kotri town (Jamshoro, Sindh), demanding release of their withheld salaries.

On 23 May 2024, Class-IV employees staged protest and marched from Government College to Press Club in Mingora city (Swat, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa) and demanded a 200% salary increase including other benefits due to high inflation.

On 23 May 2024, security guards at Jacobabad Institute of Medical Sciences (JIMS) hospital held a protest demonstration in Karachi - New Karachi town (Karachi City, Sindh), against the deductions from their salaries for housekeeping, maintenance, and security purposes.

On 23 May 2024, Community Schools Teachers Association staged protest and marched from Metropolitan Corporation to Balochistan Assembly in Quetta city (Quetta, Balochistan) demanding an increase in salaries of contract teachers and regularization of their positions.

On 23 May 2024, residents held a protest demonstration at the press club in Lahore city (Lahore, Punjab), against killing of their relatives by the criminals and the misconduct of the police personnel.

actors: Police Forces of the Philippines (2022-) Drug Enforcement Group
source: Cebu Daily News; Manila Bulletin; Sunstar (Philippines)
notes: On 23 May 2024, a drug suspect was killed in an operation of the Drug Enforcement Group in Barangay Bulacao, Cebu City (Cebu, Central Visayas). Police reported retrieving shabu (crystal meth) and other items from the suspect.

actors: Military Forces of the Philippines (2022-) Special Forces Regiment
notes: On 23 May 2024, 2 suspected NPA militants were killed in a joint operation of the Special Forces Regiment and police in Barangay Talcon (T'Boli, South Cotabato, Soccsksargen). A soldier was wounded. The operation was conducted to serve an arrest warrant against the militants. Authorities recovered weapons from the militants.

Weapons seizure: On 23 May 2024, the military seized 6 M16 assault rifles, an M653 assault rifle, magazines for M16, an improvised explosive device (IED), 212 rounds of 5.56 mm ball cartridges, 7 bandoliers, and other items from a suspected NPA arms cache in Barangay Bagsakan (Alimodian, Iloilo, Western Visayas).

Weapons seizure: On 23 May 2024, the military seized an M16 rifle, 2 improvised explosive devices (IED), 6 short magazines for the M16 rifle, and 100 bullets from a suspected NPA arms cache in Barangay Iglilico (San Joaquin, Iloilo, Western Visayas).

Other: On 23 May 2024, the wife of a soldier and another woman fought each other in Port Moresby (National Capital District). Police arrived to stop the fight and brought the two women and a soldier to the Hohola police station to resolve the issue. Two vehicles full of soldiers from Taurama Barracks arrived at the police station soon after. The wife of the soldier then claimed the responding police officer assaulted her. Suspected members of the Military Forces then assaulted the police officer resulting in a confrontation later that day (coded separately).

On 23 May 2024, suspected members of the Military Forces assaulted a police officer at Hohola police station, Port Moresby (National Capital District) resulting in a confrontation between the military forces and police. This followed a claim made by a wife of a soldier that a police officer assaulted her when responding to a fight between her and another woman earlier that day (coded separately). The confrontation was stopped and taken to Boroko Police Station where the matter was resolved with police. The military forces will conduct their own investigations.

On 23 May 2024, migrants attempted to cross the border between Belarus and Poland near Dubicze Cerkiewne, pelting stones, pieces of wood and other items toward the Polish military and police forces. The Polish servicemen clashed with them and prevented them from crossing.
On 23 May 2024, residents of Dobrzen Wielki blocked a local road by slow walking, demanding immediate repair and extension of the local traffic infrastructure.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of SNEP-FSU and GEN-CFDT, around 30 teachers gathered for a picket line outside the Milles-Roches school in Saint-Andre (Saint-Benoit) to demand the reinstatement of a colleague who had been suspended over charges of harassment before being cleared by a court of justice.

On 23 May 2024, at the call of CGT, CFDT, and other unions, around 300 striking construction gathered outside the Prefecture and subsequently drove at a slow pace in Saint-Denis (Saint-Denis) to demand better working conditions and more financial state support for the construction sector.
On 23 May 2024, government employees protested near entrance B of the Victoria Palace in Bucharest, expressing their dissatisfaction with the salary increases proposed by the Executive.

Around 23 May 2024 (month of), Russian police arrested 5 high-profile military officials and civil servants working on the country's war efforts allegedly for bribery in Moscow (Moscow). The list includes lieutenant general Vadim Shamarin responsible for MoD's communications; lieutenant colonel Vladimir Talaev, a deputy head of Moscow's Federal Penitentiary Service responsible for military supply logistics; major general Ivan Popov, formerly in charge of Russia's 58th Guards Combined Arms Army; Yuriy Kuznetsov, the head of MoD's main personnel department; and Vladimir Verteletskiy, MoD's head of defense procurement.
On 23 May 2024, people protested in Iskitim (Novosibirsk) against the construction of a metal rolling plant within the city, arguing that it would negatively impact the environment.
Interception: On 23 May 2024, Russian military shot down a drone above Elabuzhskiy district (coded to Yelabuga (Elabuzhskiy, Republic of Tatarstan)). No casualties.

On 23 May 2024, citizens and SNS representatives engaged in a protest ride through Belgrade, voicing their dissatisfaction with the Srebrenica genocide resolution within the United Nations. The resolution intends to commemorate the genocide, without labeling one nation as culpable. The discourse from the political elite in Serbia and the Republika Srpska entity of Bosnia and Herzegovina is that this resolution labels the Serbian people as 'genocidal'.

On 23 May 2024, citizens and SNS representatives engaged in a protest ride through Nis, voicing their dissatisfaction with the Srebrenica genocide resolution within the United Nations. The resolution intends to commemorate the genocide, without labeling one nation as culpable. The discourse from the political elite in Serbia and the Republika Srpska entity of Bosnia and Herzegovina is that this resolution labels the Serbian people as 'genocidal'.

On 23 May 2024, citizens and SNS representatives engaged in a protest ride through Novi Sad, voicing their dissatisfaction with the Srebrenica genocide resolution within the United Nations. The resolution intends to commemorate the genocide, without labeling one nation as culpable. The discourse from the political elite in Serbia and the Republika Srpska entity of Bosnia and Herzegovina is that this resolution labels the Serbian people as 'genocidal'.
On 23 May 2024, activists from the Animal Save movement demonstrated in Stockholm to oppose animal rights violations, to promote animal welfare and plant-based diets.
On 23 May 2024, Fridays For Future activists demonstrated in Malmo, Skane, to draw attention to environmental issues and to demand action against climate change.
On 23 May 2024, Extinction Rebellion activists demonstrated outside a Swedish bank branch in Gothenburg (Goteborg) to show their opposition to the bank's investments in fossil fuel companies.
On 23 May 2024, Extinction Rebellion activists demonstrated outside a Swedish bank branch in Stockholm to show their opposition to the bank's investments in fossil fuel companies.

On 23 May 2024, DPP Taichung City councilors held a press conference with placards and banners in Taichung City (Taichung City). They criticized the KMT for inciting the violent incident that took place in the Legislative Yuan on May 17, for threatening due process with their legislative reforms, and demanded that the people of Taiwan stand up to safeguard democracy.

On 23 May 2024, members of the National Federation of Taiwan Women's Associations, the Garden of Hope Foundation, a DPP legislator, and others held a press conference with placards in Taipei City (Taipei City). They demanded better legislation for protecting survivors of sexual violence, encouraged cultural and educational shifts towards mutual respect, and commemorated the one year anniversary of the #MeToo movement.

On 23 May 2024, KMT Taichung City councilors held a press conference with placards and banners in Taichung City (Taichung City). They criticized the DPP for obstructing recent KMT-proposed parliamentary reforms, asserted that the KMT was committed to transparency, and urged the DPP to end their hypocrisy and corruption.

On 23 May 2024, KMT Hualien County Councilors held a press conference with placards in Hualien City (Hualien City). They condemned DPP legislators in the Legislative Yuan for obstructing the legislative process and questioned what about the legislative reforms they were afraid of.

On 23 May 2024, 8 TPP legislators held a press conference with placards in Taipei City (Taipei City). They criticized the DPP for what they framed as rumor-spreading, condemned the DPP for leading to the slander of the TPP, and demanded responsible political behavior on all fronts.

On 23 May 2024, people, including DPP Kaohsiung City councilors, TSP members, and members of Citizen Mowing Action gathered to protest with placards at the KMT headquarters in Kaohsiung City (Kaohsiung City). They criticized the KMT and TPP for abusing their power in forcing through a legislative power reform bill, demanded the recall of KMT Legislative Yuan President Han Kuo-yu, and criticized the KMT for acting undemocratically.

On 23 May 2024, local residents along with members of the Matou Nature Association, Taiwan Water Conservation Alliance, and Taiwan Academy of Ecology gathered to protest with placards and banners at Matou Mountain in Cishan (Kaohsiung). They demanded the immediate halting of development of a large photovoltaic farm in the area in order to conserve the natural habitats of many plant and animal species.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), Houthi forces claimed a ballistic missile attack targeting the MSC Alexandra container ship (IMO: 9461374) in the Arabian Sea (coded to West Arabian Sea) claiming Israeli affiliation of the ship. There were no fatalities or injuries as the missiles likely impacted the water. The attack was not confirmed by other sources. Houthi forces have been labeling MSC ships as 'Israeli' possibly because of MSC's trade relations with Israeli shipping company ZIM or because of the dual Swiss-Israeli citizenship of one of MSC's co-founder and co-owner. Houthi forces claimed the attack on 24 May without specifying the date of the attack although it noted that it took place before an attack at 7:30 am Sanaa time on 23 May. The MSC Alexandra was sailing in the Arabian Sea between 22 and 23 May.
