On 22 May 2024, in Rio de Janeiro - West Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Praca Seca, Senador Camara, and Itanhanga neighborhoods. Casualties unknown.

On 22 May 2024, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Morro do Campinho and Menezes communities. At least one person, an adolescent, was shot and killed, leading to a demonstration later in the day (coded separately). Unknown shooters exchanged fire in the Vicente de Carvalho, Pavuna, and Mare neighborhoods. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2024, in Rio Largo (Alagoas), drug traffickers exchanged fire in the Conjunto Mutirao neighborhood. During the clash, a person, who was inside a residence, was shot and injured. The suspects escaped. There were no fatalities.

On 22 May 2024, in Murici (Alagoas), two unidentified armed individuals shot a man in the Conjunto Pedro Tenorio neighborhood. The individuals shot against a man, who has a police record for drug trafficking, but he was not injured. A teenage girl and a child were shot and injured by stray bullets. The individuals escaped but were arrested two days later. Motivations for the shooting are unknown. There were no fatalities.
On 22 May 2024, in Pouso Alegre (Minas Gerais), unknown armed individuals shot and killed a drug trafficker in the Sao Geraldo neighborhood. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2024, in Curitiba (Parana), two armed individuals invaded a private residence in the Fanny neighborhood and shot and killed three men. Police found firearms and portions of drugs at the location (likely indicating the deceased were drug traffickers). 3 fatalities.

On 22 May 2024, in Porto Velho (Rondonia), nine members of a drug trafficking group abducted a man and took him to the Morar Melhor housing complex, where he was tortured and injured. The victim escaped and called the military police, which arrested one suspect. Attack motivation is unknown. There were no fatalities.

On 22 May 2024, in Joao Pessoa (Paraiba), unknown individuals shot and killed a man in the Bessa neighborhood. The suspects fired against the victim, who was a drug user, and escaped. Authorship and motivations for the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), in Pontes e Lacerda (Mato Grosso), a man was killed by unknown individuals and his body was found on the BR-174 highway, with signs of torture, gagged, and with his hands and feet tied up. Circumstances of death are unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2024, in Teresina (Piaui), unidentified armed individuals shot two men in a drive-by shooting in the Planalto Uruguai neighborhood. The suspects were in a car when they fired against the men, who were committing thefts in the region. One man was shot and killed, and the other was injured. The suspects escaped. Authorship and motivations for the attack are unknown. 1 fatality.

actors: Police Forces of Brazil (2023-) Federal Police
notes: Property destruction: On 22 May 2024, in Jardim (Mato Grosso do Sul), a truck driver tried to evade a police checkpoint of the Policia Rodoviaria Federal (PRF) on the BR-267 highway. A car chase ensued, and the driver abandoned the vehicle but was arrested. From the vehicle military police seized 1,085kg of marijuana.
On 22 May 2024, in Boa Vista (Roraima), residents in the Silvio Leite neighborhood beat up and injured a man suspected of theft. Police arrested the suspect.
On 22 May 2024, in Vila Velha (Espirito Santo), locals in the Jockey de Itaparica neighborhood beat up and injured a suspected thief. Emergency responders took the victim to a hospital.
On 22 May 2024, in Brasilia (Distrito Federal), about 20,000 members of CUT and other labor unions carried out a march to demand more effective policies towards employment and working conditions.

On 22 May 2024, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), a group of people organized by the MTST, CTB, and other political movements gathered in front of the State Court (TJSP) in a demonstration against the privatization of the Basic Sanitation Company of the State of Sao Paulo (Sabesp).

On 22 May 2024, in Barueri (Sao Paulo), a group of motorcyclists gathered in the Aplhaville Industrial neighborhood and in front of a police station to demonstrate against a luxury car driver who killed another motorcyclist and injured a woman in a hit and run a few days before.

On 22 May 2024, in Porto Alegre (Rio Grande do Sul), between 30 and 40 residents of the Humaita neighborhood blocked the BR-290 highway to demand water pumps to assist with the cleaning of the neighborhood, which was affected by the floods.

On 22 May 2024, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone (Rio de Janeiro), a group of people gathered on the Ernani Cardoso avenue in a demonstration against an armed confrontation that led to the death of an adolescent in the Morro do Campinho community, Cascadura neighborhood (coded separately). They left the adolescent's body in the middle of the street, wrapped in a blanket, and set fire to tires and other objects.

On 22 May 2024, a police officer beat and seriously injured a journalist inside a bar in Gitega (Gitega, Gitega). The victim was attacked because of his profession. The officer confiscated his equipment.
On 22 May 2024, an unidentified armed group abducted a veterinary doctor in Mile 3 Bamenda - Nkwen (Bamenda 3, Mezam, Nord-Ouest).

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), an unidentified armed group killed a veterinary doctor around Bambui (Tubah, Mezam, Nord-Ouest). His body was found in an area known as Nkemnkem by the Comprehensive High School.

actors: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Forest Guards
notes: Looting: On 22 May 2024, an unidentified armed group looted electrical cables, the ENEO meter and other electrical and electronic equipment from the water and forest guard post in Amchide (Kolofata, Mayo-Sava, Extreme-Nord).

Property destruction: On 22 May 2024, near Comunidad Juan Tripailao (Araucania), unidentified individuals were suspected of having set part of a Mapuche Indigenous ceremonial site on fire in the Catrimalal/Chivilcan area. The Juan Tripailao Mapuche community, to whom the site belonged, claimed its partial destruction was in retaliation for territorial claims 150 families had been making for five years in the area since there were no sources of heat or issues with electrics at the site.

source: La Estrella de Iquique; Soy Chile
notes: On 22 May 2024, in Antofagasta (Antofagasta), workers at the National Service for Youth Social Reintegration, including members of the Association of Workers at the National Service for Youth Reintegration (AFUSE), protested on Pedro Aguirre Cerda avenue over a lack of basic resources required for their work, including nursing implements, wage stagnation, and the inadequate safety of the youths under their charge.

On 22 May 2024, in Llolleo (Valparaiso), census workers led by a coordinator who was dismissed protested this decision outside their local office. Protesters, who included the dismissed coordinator, stated that the claims that he had been underperforming and falsifying census data were spurious.

On 22 May 2024, in Vina del Mar (Valparaiso), students at the University of Vina del Mar (UVM), including members of its Student Federation, protested at the Recreo campus to demand action to improve students' mental health and against bullying and harassment after a psychology student fell from a third floor on 20 May. The protesters stated the student had thrown herself off the building.

On 22 May 2024, in Iquique (Tarapaca), teachers and teaching assistants at the Castro Ramos school protested against excessive noise from nearby construction work. Protesters argued that the noise levels, which had been excessive since the year prior, were preventing pupils from learning and forcing them to shout. The Environmental Superintendence (SMA) had ruled on 20 May that the construction company should implement noise reduction measures.

On 22 May 2024, in Puerto Montt (Los Lagos), residents of the Alto La Paloma Oriente area protested outside the Second Civil Court of Puerto Montt with signs against the impending demolition of their 14 houses given their lack of planning permission. The protesters stated the municipality was discriminating against them and seeking revenge for the inhabitants' filing of a petition to redress constitutional violations after a dispute over water supplies.

On 22 May 2024, in Llolleo (Valparaiso), residents of informal settlements in and around San Antonio and Cartagena set barricades on fire at the junction between Chile avenue (Road 66) and Baquedano street to demonstrate against an eviction order from the Supreme Court.

On 22 May 2024, in Placilla (Valparaiso), unidentified individuals set tires and wood on fire on Road 68 towards Valparaiso to demonstrate against the eviction of residents from informal settlements until they were dispersed by police. Demonstrators waved a banner that read 'No more evictions'. Similar demonstrations against evictions occurred in Llolleo and near San Antonio on the same day (coded separately).

On 22 May 2024, near San Antonio (Valparaiso), residents of informal settlements in and around San Antonio and Cartagena set barricades on fire at the junction between Chile avenue (Road 66) and Baquedano street to demonstrate against an eviction order from the Supreme Court. Similar demonstrations against evictions occurred in Placilla and near San Antonio on the same day (coded separately).

On 22 May 2024, in Bogota - Teusaquillo (Bogota, D.C.), members of the United Penitentiary Employees Union (SEUP) protested in front of the National Penitentiary and Prison Institute (INPEC) to demand the removal of the current director of the institute. Protesters attributed the recent attacks to prison personnel to the mismanagement by the director of the Inpec.

On 22 May 2024, in Barrancabermeja (Santander), unidentified individuals threw an explosive device (likely grenade), at the building of a contractor company in the La Floresta neighborhood, which caused minor infrastructure damages. There were no casualties.

Non-violent activity: Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), in the Bojaya municipality (Choco), Gulf Clan members have confined 3,350 people (830 families), including farmers and members of Indigenous groups, as a result of the placement of landmines, forced recruitment of minors, threats to local and Indigenous leaders, sexual harassment against females, and others. The communities affected are: Rio Uva, Nuevo Olivo, Villa Alta, Tawua, Salinas, Charco Gallo, Alto Rio Bojaya, Chanu, Union Choco, Usaraga, Playa Blanca, Mojaudo, and the rural area of the municipality.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), in the Buritica municipality (Antioquia), illegal miners attacked and injured two miners from the Zijin Continental Gold company, and are now trapped inside an mining site. There were no fatalities.

On 22 May 2024, near Pinguro corregimiento (Antioquia), miners blocked the road towards Uraba to protest regarding two miners that have been trapped inside a mining site after illegal miners attacked the area (coded separately).

On 22 May 2024, in Santa Marta (Magdalena), tourist workers at the El Rodadero sector protested in front of the Town Hall to demonstrate against the measures taken by the Major, claiming that they have experienced violations to their labor rights as a result of their new policies. Protesters also claim that more than 300 families are affected by these measures.

actors: FARC Dissident: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia Dissident Faction

On 22 May 2024, in the Cisneros sector (Valle del Cauca), members of the Nasa Indigenous group blocked the road between Buga and Buenaventura to demand their inclusion in the local development plans after 10 hours of failed negotiations with the local authorities. The road was reopened three hours later.

actors: Police Forces of Colombia (2022-) UNDMO: National Unit for Dialogue and Maintenance of Order

Police officers from the National Unit for Dialogue and Maintenance of Order clashed with demonstrators when trying to restore mobility, with resulting in difficulties for mobility in the 10 Street and those nearby it. The reason for the demonstration is unknown. There were no casualties.

source: El Colombiano; El Espectador; El Tiempo (Colombia)
notes: On 22 May 2024, in Bogota - Chapinero (Bogota, D.C.), rioters (likely students) near the Universidad Pedagogica tried to set on fire a public bus while the driver was inside the vehicle. The driver escaped and one of the rioters took over the bus and drove it inside the university campus. Rioters also clashed with anti-disturbance officers. The reasons for the demonstration are unknown. The bus was later recovered and rioters were dispersed at around 4:50 p.m. There were no casualties.

source: Comores Infos; Habari Za Comores; Hayba FM
notes: Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), gendarmes arrested a member of the Juwa Party in Dembeni (Mbadjini Ouest, Grand Comore) 4 days before the inauguration ceremony of President Azali Assoumani. No further information.

On 22 May 2024, in Aguacaliente, Cartago, several residents threw stones at police officers after they detained an alleged drug dealer in an alleyway in Manuel de Jesus Jimenez neighborhood. One of the rioters shot at an officer in his left arm. 1 injured.

On 22 May 2024, in Carmona, Guanacaste, students from the Technical Professional College of Nandayure, demonstrated outside their school due to alleged budgetary issues affecting basic services like water and electricity and infrastructure. The school was completely closed during the protest.

On 22 May 2024, in Cartago, Cartago, people demonstrated to exert pressure to the members of the Board of Directors of the Costa Rican Social Security Fund (CCSS) for the construction of the new Hospital of the province at the same time that the board conducts a meeting to decide what will be done with respect to this new hospital. Displacement: Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), over 80,000 new displaced persons arrived at the Konga Konga displaced site in the Kisangani commune (Kisangani, Tshopo) since 5 May. They were fleeing the violence between the Mbole and Lengola communities in the Lubunga commune.

actors: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 22 May 2024, activists from civil movements organized a protest in Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu) to denounce the water shortage throughout the city. They also demand the resignation of the provincial director of REGIDESO. Police intervened to disperse protesters. 4 activists were arrested.

On 22 May 2024, M23 operating in the Mupfunyi-Shanga grouping, Bahunde chiefdom in the Masisi territory, dropped a bomb in the Buzi groupement, Buhavu chiefdom (Kalehe, Sud-Kivu), coded to Minova. No fatality. 1 civilian injured.

Other: On 22 May 2024, in Quito (Pichincha), president Daniel Noboa announced executive decree 275 requesting a new deployment of the Armed Forces in the provinces of Guayas, Manabi, El Oro, Los Rios, Santa Elena, Sucumbios, Orellana and the canton of Camilo Ponce Enriquez in Azuay. This is the second phase of the declaration of the state of emergency due to the ongoing internal armed conflict. Human Rights Watch indicated evidence of human rights violations after the declaration of the internal conflict.

On 22 May 2024, Fano militias clashed with local militias (coded as Kebele militias) in Jiru Dada kebele, Dera woreda (North Shewa, Oromia), after the Fano militias entered the village and set alight civilian houses. Casualties unknown.

On 22 May 2024, Fano claimed to have clashed with ENDF in Arb Gebeya 1 (Dera, South Gondar, Amhara), Gelawdios (coded separately), and Anbesame (coded separately), destroying the 78th Brigade of ENDF (unconfirmed) and killing 80 ENDF soldiers (unconfirmed). The ENDF first moved from Sanja and North Gondar to destroy elements of Fano in the area. Unconfirmed number of fatalities coded as 10. 10 fatalities split across three locations and coded as 4 for this event.

On 22 May 2024, Fano claimed to have clashed with ENDF in Gelawdios (Dera, South Gondar, Amhara), Arb Gebeya 1 (coded separately), and Anbesame (coded separately), destroying the 78th Brigade of ENDF (unconfirmed) and killing 80 ENDF soldiers (unconfirmed). The ENDF started moving from Sanja and North Gondar to destroy elements of Fano in the area. Unconfirmed number of fatalities coded as 10. 10 fatalities split across three locations and coded as 3 for this event.

On 22 May 2024, Fano claimed to have clashed with ENDF in Anbesame (Dera, South Gondar, Amhara), Gelawdios (coded separately) and Arb Gebeya 1 (coded separately), destroying the 78th Brigade of ENDF (unconfirmed) and killing 80 ENDF soldiers (unconfirmed). The ENDF started moving from Sanja and North Gondar to destroy elements of Fano in the area. Unconfirmed number of fatalities coded as 10. 10 fatalities split across three locations and coded as 3 for this event.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), ENDF clashed with Fano militia in Tsehay Mewcha kebele in Delanta Woreda (North Wello, Amhara). ENDF claimed to have killed an unspecified number of militants. Unspecified number of fatalities coded as 3. ENDF seized 4 Kalashnikov guns, 2 Turkish-made pistols, 1 ASKS gun, 172 Kalashnikov bullets, and 1 smoke bomb.

On 22 May 2024, suspected Fano militias kidnapped eight ethnic Qemant civilians from their homes in Shinfa town, Metema woreda (Amhara), and looted unspecified amounts and types of civilian properties.

source: Borkena Ethiopian News; Deutsche Welle; EMS
notes: On 22 May 2024, and for a second day, ethnic Tigray militias exchanged fire with ethnic Afar pastoralists in a location bordering Raya Azebo with Afar region (location coded to Boye Gerarsa) in Raya Azebo (Southern Tigray, Tigray). The clash followed the attacks by the militiamen that resulted in seven cattle herders being killed (coded separately). Casualties unknown.

actors: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Oromia State Police
notes: On 22 May 2024, elementary school students rioted (means unknown) in Hare Kelo (Gora Dola, Guji, Oromia) opposing sitting for grade 8 regional examination. The rioters claimed that they did not get adequate time to prepare for the examination. The Oromia region police assaulted and arrested 12-13 students who participated in the riot. Extent of injuries unknown/not reported.

On 22 May 2024, in Georgetown, Demerara-Mahaica, teachers affiliated with the Guyana Teachers Union (GTU) staged a protest with banners outside the Ministry of Education demanding better salaries. The protest was part of a national strike.

On 22 May 2024, in New Amsterdam, East Berbice-Corentyne, a group of family members held a protest outside the New Amsterdam Public Hospital demanding answers over the cause of the deaths of two siblings at the facility.

On 22 May 2024, in San Juan Pueblo, Atlantida, unidentified armed men in a vehicle shot and killed a man while he was heading to his farm (drive-by). The man lost control of the vehicle during a chase, at which point the assailants shot him to death. Authorities have ruled out robbery as a motive, leaving the reason for the attack unknown. 1 fatality.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), in Comayaguela, Francisco Morazan, a man was killed and his body was found dead in the Guacerique River with his hands and feet tied. The reason for the killing is unknown. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2024, in El Chile, Cortes, a group of dump truck drivers protested in support of the reopening of a mining company's operations that had been temporarily closed due to mining exploitation concerns expressed by local residents. The protesters claimed that they had not operated for more than 20 days due to the lack of work in the sector.

On 22 May 2024, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, the union of workers at the Francisco Morazan National Pedagogical University (UPNFM) protested against the violation of institutional regulations within the university. They specifically demanded an intervention to address the illegal appointments they claimed to have persisted at the university for years. The union emphasized the need for adherence to proper institutional procedures and transparency in university operations.
On 22 May 2024, in Tegucigalpa, Francisco Morazan, administrative employees of the Ministry of Health protested against being forced to transfer to a rented building, citing safety concerns.

On 22 May 2024, in Puerto Cortes, Cortes, a group of residents from the Brisas de Tramade sector blocked the local highway in protest to demand the permanent closure of a mining company's operations. They accused the company of depleting natural resources and causing multiple diseases due to pollution.

On 22 May 2024, in San Pedro de Catacamas, Olancho, a group residents took over the highway to protest against the company that won the tender for a road pavement project in the area that was approved but never started.
On 22 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, an unknown number of armed individuals shot and killed a businessman on the N Avenue, in the Pacot neighbourhood. Motivation unknown. 1 fatality.

Looting: On 22 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, gang members looted the Faculty of Lay and Economic Sciences, located in the Champs de Mars neighbourhood. Solar panels and other materials were stolen. Some material damages were mentioned.

Property destruction: On 22 May 2024, in Port-au-Prince, Ouest, overnight, members of the Living-Together gang-led initiative (a.k.a. Viv Ansanm Gang) demolished a police station in the Grand Ravine neighbourhood after having chased several civilians who were using it as shelter.

source: Haaretz; Jerusalem Post; N12; Times of Israel; Walla!News; Ynet
notes: On 22 May 2024, hundreds protested near IDF headquarters in Tel Aviv city, calling on the government to secure the immediate release of all hostages being held in Gaza by Hamas. Protesters blocked traffic on the nearby Begin Street by lighting a bonfire on the road. Protesters also briefly blocked traffic on Ayalon Highway, likely by standing or walking on the roads. The protest occurred following the release of footage showing the abduction of five female soldiers by Hamas during their attack on 7 October. Relatives of hostages took part in the protest. The Mayor of Tel Aviv was present at the protest.

source: Haaretz; Jerusalem Post; N12; Times of Israel; Walla!News; Ynet
notes: On 22 May 2024, at least 200 protested outside of the prime minister's office in Jerusalem - Givat Ram (Judean Mountains), calling on the government to secure the immediate release of all hostages being held in Gaza by Hamas. Protesters blocked traffic, likely by standing or walking on the roads. The protest occurred following the release of footage showing the abduction of five female soldiers by Hamas during their attack on 7 October.

On 22 May 2024, right-wing activists from the Gvura Forum, which includes bereaved families who lost relative in the current war, marched and protested outside of the prime minister's office in Jerusalem - Givat Ram (Judean Mountains), calling on the government to continue the war and put military pressure on Hamas.

notes: On 22 May 2024, an explosive-laden drone fell and exploded in an open area near Bet Hillel (Zefat, HaZafon). No casualties occurred. Hezbollah forces in Lebanon likely fired the drone.

On 22 May 2024, about 200 protested in Pardes Hanna Karkur (Hadera, Haifa), calling on the government to secure the immediate release of all hostages being held in Gaza by Hamas. The protest occurred following the release of footage showing the abduction of five female soldiers by Hamas during their attack on 7 October.

On 22 May 2024, hundreds protested in Raanana (Petah Tiqwa, HaMerkaz), calling on the government to secure the immediate release of all hostages being held in Gaza by Hamas. The protest occurred following the release of footage showing the abduction of five female soldiers by Hamas during their attack on 7 October.

The protest occurred following the release of footage showing the abduction of five female soldiers by Hamas during their 7 October attack.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), traders protested within the industrial area of Thika town (Thika Town, Kiambu) against the poor state of road. The group demanded the government to tarmac the road.

The group demanded the government through the Teachers' Service Commission (TSC) to comply with a recent court order to grant them permanent and pensionable employment terms as well as compensation for the period worked while underpaid.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), residents protested in an unspecified location within Katulani ward (coded as Katulani, Kitui Central, Kitui) against the employment of an alleged outsider as ward administrator. The group demanded the governor to address the matter.

On 22 May 2024, hundreds of residents protested in Soweto neighborhoods of Nairobi - Embakasi South (Embakasi South, Nairobi) against the demolition of houses on riparian land, alleging unfair targeting. The group demanded both the county and national governments to help address the matter.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), residents protested in Ndunyu Njeru (Kinangop, Nyandarua) against the poor state of the Nyeri-Aberdares road. The group demanded necessary authorities to fix the road.

On 22 May 2024, residents, barricaded the Ruiru - Matangi road with burning tires in Matangi (coded to the nearest known location as Ruiru, Ruiru, Kiambu) in demonstration against the poor state of the road. The group demanded the relevant authorities to address the matter.

On 22 May 2024, in Loreto, Baja California Sur, a group of teachers protested and called on the governor to respect their labor rights, mainly those related to salary payments. The demonstration took place while the governor was visiting the area.

On 22 May 2024, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, teachers from the National Union of Education Workers (SNTE), attached to the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) took over at least 12 gas stations in different parts of the city and allow drivers to be supplied with fuel for free. This event was part of the activities on the eighth day of their protest to demand the cancelation of the Education Reform.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Benito Juarez, workers of the SME demonstrated in front of the PAN's national headquarters against the extinction of Luz y Fuerza del Centro organization during President Felipe Calderon's administration. The demonstration prevented workers from leaving the party's offices. The PAN leader accused the protesters of being followers of President Lopez Obrador and of carrying out the protest to affect their activities during the electoral period.

On 22 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Coyoacan, hundred university students from CCH Naucalpan took over the general direction of the College of Sciences and Humanities to demand a dialogue table with the general director as well as the director of the Naucalpan campus. This event was sparked to demand the eradication of rioter groups after the death of a student at CCH Naucalpan.

source: El Sol de Acapulco; La Jornada
notes: On 22 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, dozens of teachers belonging to the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) demonstrate in several metro stations in the city center, including Pino Suarez against the 10% salary increase proposed by the authorities. This event was also replicated in the metro stations of Venustiano Carranza (coded separately).

On 22 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, about thirty business owners demonstrate in front of the National Palace demanding that the Moneda street be reopened. The protesters stated that the fences prevent passage which affects their clients. The participants pointed out that this situation has affected them since the coronavirus pandemic.

On 22 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, about 20 tourist police officers held a protest against the mistreatment, unjustified arrests and a series of abuses to which they are subjected by their commanders. The protesters requested the intervention of the secretary of citizen security. The protesters blocked the road in front of the Tourist Police base in Colonia Juarez.

On 22 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico - Venustiano Carranza, teachers belonging to the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) demonstrate in San Lazaron and Pantitlan metro stations to protest against the 10% salary increase proposed by the authorities. This event was also replicated in the metro stations of the city center (coded separately).

On 22 May 2024, in Ciudad de Mexico, activists from Greenpeace held a protest at the headquarters of different political parties with advertisements collected on the streets of Mexico City against pollution generated by electoral propaganda.
On 22 May 2024, in San Francisco del Rincon, Guanajuato, a man riding a bicycle was shot dead by two armed men on a motorcycle (drive-by) in Barrio San Miguel. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2024, in Tarimoro, Guanajuato, unidentified armed individuals in a car shot and killed the father of the candidate of the Morena party to mayor in the city center (drive-by). The victim was also a former councilor in the city council for the PRD party. Also, another person who was the former director of Public Works was injured and died later at the hospital. The victims were distributing electoral propaganda when they were attacked. 2 fatalities.

source: El Sol de Acapulco; La Jornada
notes: On 22 May 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, more than 200 of residents, transporters, and merchants from the main market blocked Boulevard Vicente Guerrero to demand greater security in the face of extortion and threats from criminal groups. The event occurred after an attempted kidnapping was recorded in the vicinity of the market a day before and a municipal police patrol was shot at (coded separately). The protesters asked for the resignation of the directors of the ministerial police who they accuse of having deals with criminal groups.
Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, a person was killed and the body was found with signs of torture in Colonia Benito Juarez. 1 fatality.

source: El Sol de Acapulco; La Jornada
notes: On 22 May 2024, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, armed men shot at several stall of the main market in Colonia Emiliano Zapata. One merchant died and a woman was injured. This attacks followed a demonstration against extortions carried out by merchants (coded separately). 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2024, in San Jeronimo Palantla, Guerrero, three hundred members of Nahua Indigenous militia from Nuevo Amanecer community of the CIPOG-EZ attacked the community of San Jeronimo Palantla and clashed with fifty armed individuals from the community. The members of the Nuevo Amanecer community were also affiliated with the CIPOEG-EZ Indigenous organization, who accuse the San Jeronimo community of having links with the Los Ardillos gang. The attack followed an attack by residents of San Jeronimo Palantla on Nuevo Amanecer on the same day. According to a representative of the CIPOG-EZ, the attack was a response to the inaction of the authorities in the face of the attacks being suffered by residents of Nuevo Amanecer by community members of San Jeronimo Palantla. During the two-day clashes three vehicles, three houses and a police station were set on fire. Officially there were no fatalities although CIPOG-EZ announced the death of one of its members. The clashes began on May 22 and ended on May 23 (coded separately). At least 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2024, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, teachers and students from the Faculty of Chemical Sciences of the Autonomous University of Guerrero blocked Avenida Lazaro Cardenas in front of their educational campus to demand transparency in the internal election that took place a day before.

On 22 May 2024, in Pachuca de Soto, Hidalgo, residents of the Goevillas and Juan C Doria neighborhoods blocked the street that connects with the Nuevo Hidalgo Boulevard to denounce that they have drainage problems after public works of paving and installation of pipes were carried out in the area.

On 22 May 2024, in Acapa, Hidalgo, residents detained trucks with construction materials. The residents stated that these were sent by the mayor late at night to the communities despite an electoral ban that forbids proselytist action. Demonstrators claimed that the materials were sent with the purpose of trying to coerce the vote in favor of the Labor Party candidate.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), in Zapopan, Jalisco, a man was killed and only his torso was found inside a bag in Colonia Benito Juarez. 1 fatality.
Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), in Zapopan, Jalisco, a woman was killed and her body was found wrapped in blankets in colonia Agua Fria. 1 fatality.
On 22 May 2024, in Ecatepec de Morelos, Mexico, residents held a protest on R1 Avenue to denounce the lack of water in their neighborhoods.

On 22 May 2024, in Morelia, Michoacan, members of the Union of Workers at the Service of the Executive Branch (Staspe) blocked around 11 roads around the city center to demand the dismissal of the head of the Forestry Commission of Michoacan (Cofom) after his government is ignoring their requests.

Around 22 May 2024 (between 21 - 22 May), in Zirimicuaro, Michoacan, a man was killed and his handcuffed body was found on 22 May in a plot of land known as Las Lajas about 4 kilometers from the Uruapan-Ziracuaretiro highway. It is suspected that the victim was abducted on 21 May in Colonia El Colorin in Uruapan. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2024, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, dozens of members of the Administrative Workers Union of the Autonomous University of the State of Morelos (STAUAEM) demonstrated to demand a salary increase after 1,500 workers are earning below the minimum wage.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), in Emiliano Zapata, Morelos, a video was published on social networks showing armed individuals beating a man who was suspected of having been found stealing in Colonia 5 de Mayo. The armed individuals interrogate and beat the suspect who ends up saying that he was caught stealing. In the video the armed individuals threaten to beat those caught stealing in the neighborhoods of 3 de Mayo, Cumbres, Gerardo Perez, Lomas de Jiutepec, 28 de Agosto, and Lomas de Trujillo.

On 22 May 2024, in Ciudad Apodaca, Nuevo Leon, according to witnesses, two armed men shot at a group of people in front of a house in Colonia Robles. A man was killed and a 15-year-old man was injured. 1 fatality, 1 injured.

The parents accuse the treasurer of keeping the money and suspect that the director of the institution could be an accomplice.

On 22 May 2024, in El Espinal, Sinaloa, 20 residents blocked the Mazatlan-Culiacan free highway to ask authorities to intensify actions to extinguish a fire that started last weekend in the Tacuichamona mountain range.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), in Ciudad Obregon, Sonora, a 15-year-old boy was killed and his body was found in Colonia Luis Donaldo Colosio. The body was handcuffed, gagged, and had signs of torture. 1 fatality.

On 22 May 2024, outside Santa Ana, Sonora, there was an armed clash between two criminal groups outside the urban zone of Santa Ana. In social networks, it was mentioned that there were clashes in the area known as El Claro, which lasted several hours. Four people were killed and two vehicles, five AK-47 rifles, a Barret machine gun and magazines were seized. 4 fatalities.

On 22 May 2024, in Villahermosa, Tabasco, approximately 500 government workers attached to the STSEMT marched on Avenida Gregorio Mendez. The participants blocked the road in front of the SEGOB facilities to protest against the lack of recognition of the affiliation of at least 800 workers.

actors: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: Around 22 May 2024 (between 21 - 23 May), FAMa stated to have conducted operation against JNIM militants in the area of Sare Hama (Mopti, Mopti). A JNIM base was destroyed and several militants were killed. A vehicle, a weapon, three magazine and three motorcycles were seized the statement said. 3 fatalities coded.
On 22 May 2024, IS Sahel militants attacked the village of Balga (Ansongo, Gao). Three civilians were killed including the imam, and two were injured.
On 22 May 2024, IS Sahel militants burst into a village between Todyel and Koissa (Ansongo, Gao). The militants assaulted a man and seized livestock.
On 22 May 2024, IS Sahel militants burst into the village of Tejarert, near Menaka (Menaka, Menaka). Three young men were injured.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), Medicine and Dentistry students marched in Marrakech, Gueliz (Marrakech, Marrakech-Safi) to denounce the suspension of students as a punitive measure for participating in a strike.
On 22 May 2024, regional taxi drivers staged a sit-in protest in Anza (Agadir, Souss-Massa) to condemn the rise in the cost of gas canisters.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), teachers at Abdel Malik Saadi University held a sit-in protest in Tetouan (Tetouan, Tanger-Tetouan-Al Hoceima), to show their support for Palestine. They called for the end of Moroccan universities' academic cooperation with Israeli universities.

On 22 May 2024, dozens of activists staged a sit-in protest in front of the parliament in Rabat, Hassan (Rabat, Rabat-Sale-Kenitra) to show their support for European countries' decision to recognize a Palestinian state. They also called for an end to Israeli military operations in Rafah. The protest was organized by the Working Group for Palestine.

On 22 May 2024, dozens of victims of a real estate fraud in Bernoussi staged a protest sit-in in front of the tribunal of Casablanca, Sidi Belyout (Casablanca, Casablanca-Settat), demanding to be compensated for their financial losses.

On 22 May 2024, in Managua municipality, the Ortega-Murillo government placed Daniel Ortega's brother and former Chief of the Nicaraguan Army under house arrest on the outskirts of the city. This action followed an interview where he declared that there was no successor capable of filling Daniel Ortega's shoes upon his demise, thus casting doubt on the leadership abilities of the president's wife and current vice president. The house arrest was disguised as a Specialized Medical Care Unit set by the Health Ministry and under the supervision of the Police.

On 22 May 2024, youths from Umuahala Obuzor Asa protested and blocked (through unspecified means) the gate of a steel company in the community, coded to Asa (Ukwa West, Abia) over the death of a local crane operator whom they claimed was pushed to death by her superior after she rejected his advances. Other sources claimed that soldiers guarding the company shot at and beat up some protesters. Casualties are unknown.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), an unidentified armed group abducted three persons in Calabar (Calabar Municipal, Cross River) when they invaded a meeting that the victims were a part of. Mobile phones and other valuables were also stolen and one of the abductees was released on 22 May. The other two abductees included a university lecturer.

On 22 May 2024, an unidentified armed group abducted one civilian from Umuchiana community in Ekwulobia (Aguata, Anambra). The abductee was rescued by police forces that chased after the abductors (coded separately).

On 22 May 2024, an unidentified armed group abducted a man along Umuchiana village in Ekwulobia (Aguata, Anambra). The police intervened after receiving a distress call and trailed the abductor. The armed group threw the hostage out of their car while trying to escape from the police. The police rescued the hostage and recovered a car.

On 22 May 2024, the Nigerian troops responding to a distress call repelled an attack by a Katsina militia around the Maidabino River line and Kanawa villages, coded to Kanawa village (Dan-Musa, Katsina). The troops found the militia with stolen cows. They shot and killed one of them while others escaped with gunshot wounds.

On 22 May 2024, the Nigerian troops, the police, and the Community Watch clashed with a Katsina militia while raiding their camps in Saunin Bala Maidala village, coded to Ungwan Maganda (Dan-Musa, Katsina). The militiamen were overpowered and fled. The troops rescued eighteen hostages in their captivity. There were no fatalities.

On 22 May 2024, the Nigerian troops clashed with a Katsina militia while responding to a distress call on stolen cows around Alhassanwa village, coded to Yan Malamai (Dan-Musa, Katsina). The militia abandoned the cows and fled. There were no fatalities.

On 22 May 2024, police forces responded to a distress call and engaged an unidentified armed group in an armed clash at Ndike (Orumba North, Anambra). One person who was abducted by the group at Umuchiana community (coded separately) was rescued, the group escaped.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), police forces raided the hideout of an unidentified armed group, engaged them in an armed clash and killed an unspecified number of members of the armed group. The raid resulted from an ambush on policemen (coded separately), where 13 of their rifles were stolen. 10 of the rifles were recovered, location coded to Ohoro (Ughelli North, Delta) where the first ambush took place. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.
Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), the Askarawa defence militia killed two people accused of espionage for the marauding militia groups in Zamfara state, coded to Gusau (Gusau, Zamfara).
On 22 May 2024, suspected armed pastoralists killed one civilian when they attacked Edikwu Icho (Apa, Benue). An unspecified number of persons were declared missing.
On 22 May 2024, a Kaduna militia killed one civilian and abducted two others at Kidinu (Chikun, Kaduna) coded to nearby Kakau. The murdered victim was a male while the abductees were women.

Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), soldiers pursued and killed two suspected Kaduna militia informants near Mararaban Bishini, coded as Bishini (Kachia, Kaduna). The suspects were conveying foodstuff of drugs on motorcycles before they were intercepted by the soldiers.
Around 22 May 2024 (as reported), police forces from Operation Zenda in Benue state killed civilian at his residence in Makurdi (Makurdi, Benue). The reason for the attack is unknown.

On 22 May 2024, a Sokoto militia attacked civilians at Takalmawa community, coded to neighboring Kurawa (Sabon Birni, Sokoto) and killed four residents. 17 persons were abducted and cattle were rustled by the militia who broke into homes in the community.

On 22 May 2024, hundreds ANCYL members, taxi associations, religious leaders (unspecified), and community members marched from Giant Stadium to the police station in Soshanguve (City of Tshwane, Gauteng), demanding an immediate solution to the problem of crime in their area.

On 22 May 2024, doctors and nurses picketed outside the Mofumahadi Manapo Mopeli Regional Hospital in Phuthaditjhaba (Thabo Mofutsanyane, Free State), demanding the deployment of private security to ensure their safety following a recent incident where a doctor was shot and wounded during a burglary at the hospital's doctors' quarters.

On 22 May 2024, around 50 Pikitup contract workers picketed outside the Johannesburg council in Johannesburg - Braamfontein (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng), demanding permanent employment after being overlooked despite years of service.

On 22 May 2024, thousands of RISE Mzansi supporters marched to the Western Cape Legislature in Cape Town - Central Business District (City of Cape Town, Western Cape), demanding improved service delivery.

On 22 May 2024, NUMSA members gathered outside the offices of SA Steel Mill in Meyerton (Sedibeng, Gauteng) against the dismissal of some of their members in April 2024. The demonstrators stopped a moving minibus taxi, forcibly removed passengers, and assaulted a woman as she was traveling to work. Private security fired rubber bullets to disperse the demonstrators. Four demonstrators were hospitalized due to their injuries (extent of injuries unknown/not reported).

On 22 May 2024, Sol Plaatje University (SPU) students protested outside the Moroko Hall and Luka Jantjie House on the main campus in Kimberley (Frances Baard, Northern Cape) against being evicted from their residences due to non-payment of rent.

On 22 May 2024, for the third day, Pikitup casual workers barricaded the entrance of some of the Pickitup depots with burning tires around Johannesburg (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng), demanding permanent employment after being overlooked despite years of service.

On 22 May 2024, about 40 'Gate 7' informal settlement residents barricaded the Voortrekker Road with burning tires, burning branches, mattresses, rocks, and a container in Cape Town - Maitland (City of Cape Town, Western Cape), demanding basic services including water, toilets, and electricity.

On 22 May 2024, hundreds of residents from Knysna marched to the municipal building in Knysna (Eden, Western Cape), demanding investigations into allegations of nepotism and job selling by senior municipal officials.
